title: Make French Toast
content:
Easy to Make French Toast Hello and welcome to in the kitchen with Matt,
I am your host, Matt Taylor. Today I am going to show you how to make French toast. This
is super easy to make, let's get started. Now for the ingredients, I have some really
thick sliced bread; you can use whatever bread you want, sourdough, cinnamon raisin bread,
whatever you like. I have a bowl and a fork, I have a pie pan here which works great, I
have one large egg, two tablespoons of milk, and one-quarter teaspoon of vanilla. So now
what we are going to do is we are going to crack our egg and add it to this bowl. Ok,
and then we take our milk and go ahead and add that in there. All right, now let's go
ahead and add our vanilla extract. That will add some nice flavor. Ok, then we will just
go ahead and mix this altogether. And it winds up being about one egg, per two pieces of
toast. Go ahead and put it in there, and mix it all around, both sides, and I am going
to set it right here. Let's do another one; we will mop it all up. 
Ok we turn our stovetop on, in between medium and medium high. And then once our skillet
is hot, we take some butter, and we will go ahead and put it on the bottom here, like
this, coat the bottom. And grab our toast and put it in, just like that. And you cook
it until it gets brown; it is about a minute and a half per side. Ok now we want to turn
these, ooh that looks great. And then on this side, what I like to do is while it is on
there, take some more butter and just put it on the top. Ok now we will take a look,
it looks good. All right, now what we do is we add our toppings, I am going to do a classic
maple syrup and powdered sugar. All right, our French toast is done; you can put whatever
toppings you want, strawberries, blackberries, blueberries, maple syrup, powdered sugar,
whatever you want to do. It is super easy to make, if I can do it, you can do it. I
am Matt Taylor; this has been another episode of In the Kitchen with Matt, thank you for
joining me, if you have any questions or comments, put them down below and I will get back to
you. Time for me to dive into this. Woah that is good.

title: Make French Toast
content: good morning and welcome to Tessa's kitchen this morning I'm going to be making a sweet hearts french toast it's french toast kicked up a notch stuck with mascarpone e cheese and strawberries if you're looking for that special thing to make for that special person this would absolutely be the recipe to make I'm starting off with some simple and beautiful ingredients this is a loaf of potato bread that I got from our local bakery and some really nice strawberries I washed my strawberries very well and sliced about a half a cup to a cup into thin slices the first step is to macerate your strawberries by doing that you want to add a sugar and I'm using honey this is a step that I probably should have done last night you want two strawberries to be refrigerated for at least an hour and overnight is better helps to bring out the flavor and the juices of the strawberries the next step is making the filling and it's pretty easy I have one cup of mascarpone e cheese and I'm adding about two tablespoons of confection sugar and you can make your sweeter if you wish and by the way you want your mascarpone e cheese at room temperature it whips much easier at room temperature than at cold temperature but gotta sneak a taste and now the bread typically a French bread or a French loaf is used for french toast that makes sense but in my kitchen today I'm using a loaf of potato bread the potato bread is dense and I thought it would hold up nicely and we'll just soak up all that egg I'm making three slices of french toast this morning to for him and one for me now comes the tricky part make a cut into the center of the bread from one side Center to the other going around the bottom gently cut into the center towards the top extending your filling area so you can get as much cheese and strawberries in there as you can you want to have a bite of cheese and strawberry in everybody if you wanted you could go ahead and slice the pieces and to spread the cheese place the strawberries and put the top on but I like how the top remains intact and just remember it's the effort that counts place and smear center of each slice of bread with the cheese and make sure that you push some up into the top so each bite has some cheese mascarpone e cheese is not available on all the grocery stores and there is a substitute that you can make and I'll provide that recipe and the show me more section below and the same with the strawberries make sure you get some strawberries up there in the top put one nice layer of strawberries then gently press down on the top to make sure that everything stays in there at this point get your griddle or skillet ready and put it on low heat I have an electric stove and I'll have the heat between a three and four probably start at it for then whenever I flip them I'll turn the heat closer down to three I'll probably end up flipping these two or three times just to get an even browning and to make sure the inside is all melted and heated through you can even add some lemon zest orange zest with cheese to give it more flavor along with the strawberries you can add some lemon juice orange juice a liqueur or even a balsamic vinegar would add flavor you can find this recipe and more on my facebook and google+ page remember to come give me a visit here I have five eggs and about a half a cup of milk I think I went a little overboard on the eggs I probably could have used three i'm also adding a quarter teaspoon of pure vanilla extract and i'm going to give it a good whisk you now dip each side with the egg wash make sure you let the eggs soak into the bread give it some taps with your fork to make sure that the cheese and strawberries are sealed you next melt some butter on the bottom of your griddle or your skillet you and lay in your french toast I ended up flipping these three times and I cooked each side a minute each time you can use any fruit you can use blueberries bananas cranberries blackberries ooh that one would be good and a little sprinkle of confess Jenner's sugar on top you now I'm going to play some strawberries on top just remind them what's inside if you make this stuffed french toast for that special someone I'm sure you'll be getting some brownie points you okay it's time to cut it open and see what's inside beautiful just fill with that rich creamy cheese and fresh strawberries time to give it a taste you wow that turned out amazing I hope you make this love it and enjoy please remember to hit the like button and subscribe for future recipe videos from Kaz's kitchen you can also find me on google+ facebook and pinterest come visit again and enjoy

content: hey welcome back to cooking around channel this is Tony again what do I have for you today French toast and why French toast now because I have three requests and it's one of my breakfast favorite so here we go I'll just look at all these goodies that I have here and look at this I'm having american-style toast bread this is absolutely awesome and I'm going to use one egg some cynicism the minimum and some Canadian maple syrup so all the gradients you see here is for one portion so you may have to double it or triple it for more serving so let's get going okay here we go grab yourself a tiny bowl on these little whiskey disky little things and now I want you to grab one large egg and I want you to crack at it put it in the bowl just like that are we done no we're not now add 1 to 2 dashes of salt and now this depends on you 1/2 a teaspoon of vanilla extract now here you can add a dash of cinnamon but you know something I only like to add it in the end so that's really up to you now and now a quarter cup of milk okay let's start whisking this and let's keep on going until it is velvety smooth so this is basically what we want now this is how I like to do it get yourself a large plate like this and take the mixture now and pour it on to the large plate believe me this will make your life a lot easier now this mixture is made for four slices of bread here I'm using half white and half whole-wheat that depends on you so now I want you to put them into the plate just like that leave it there for about a couple of seconds move it around move it around now I want you to flip it over just like this so we can have everything sucked up into the bread evenly and now what I want you to do is I just want you to let this sit for about five minutes and that all the mixture soak into the bread and once again we shall be back grab yourself a large Teflon pan and let's add a little bit of butter now you don't have that butter but you know something I like it it adds flavor so that's basically up to you okay now as you can see here all the mixture has sucked up into the bread just like this and we are ready okay the pan is on medium heat so let's start adding the toast once you put it down let it stay for a couple of seconds don't move it around we'll be doing that later so here's our third piece can I fit in that fourth piece off I just move it a little bit it fits just perfect just like this depending on your settings this should take about two minutes but you know something to take a little peek and here you can see it requires another half a minute so once again I shall be back okay one side is done so let's flip it around and now I want you to let this go for another two minutes and yes you could peek again to see if it's done so let's now get going with this because I'm getting very very hungry great here it is get your fancy dancy plate and add one toast just like that let's put another piece just like this let's fancy it up and put another one like this and of course one at the top here now of course I have to Center it and here comes one of my favorite toppings butter oh this is going to be so awesome now this is where I like to add the cinnamon right now over the hot french toast and this is going to be awesome and what I usually do is I just put a light coat on but you can add as much as you want and here's my favorite topping Canadian maple syrup and this just brings all the flavors together don't you just want it dig in there this is absolutely awesome and now I'm sorry I'm going to have to tease you with this just to show you how much I love this dish and just for a bit of a teaser let's do a taste test take a look under here see how that is absolutely perfect so where am I going to start I don't know let's just take one piece from here just like this and let's stick another little piece from there and I just want you to see how moist it is it's absolutely moist it's absolutely perfect and you know it's going to be good so all I can say now is thank you very much for allowing me to share this recipe I hope that you and your friends enjoy it and I will see you again once again on my next cooking video thank you from tony and cookingaround and please enjoy and keep those comments coming

title: Make French Toast
content:
Hi. I'm Noopur on behalf of Expert Village.
In this clip, I'm going to tell you how to make French toast sandwich. Now let's begin.
First we take raw egg, beat it well, add coriander leaves to it, some pepper and salt. Now we
take a slice of bread, soak it into this liquid, both sides. We take few drops of oil on a
nonstick frying pan and place this onto it. The other side as well. Now this takes two
to three minutes maximum to be cooked properly. Now we take this and place it on a plate,
and we can have this with either tomato sauce or maybe mustard sauce,
as per your choice. Your French toast is ready.

title: Make French Toast
content:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I want to show you how I make my waffle French toast. It is so
easy to make. I absolutely love making it for breakfast on weekends, especially if you
have people coming over because it looks like you have really put a lot of effort into it
but you really didn't. It is just incredibly simple and easy. The ingredients you'll need
are very few. What I've got here is some bread - you can use any bread you want. I am using
my homemade honey oat bread because it's just delicious - so I am using that. You need a
couple of eggs, some brown sugar, a small little pinch of cinnamon, vanilla, and milk.
That's it! You'll also need some melted butter and your waffle maker or your waffle iron.
I've got mine preheating so it is going to be ready for us whenever we are ready to use
it. Alright, I've got a little baking dish here and in it I am going to put my eggs.
I am going to give those a quick little whisk and I am going to add in my milk. This is
pretty much my standard - you know, my standard, what am I trying to say? Please help me - French
toast! I'm just, I'm going to make a smaller batch of it. I'm not using three eggs and
the full amount of milk. I am going to use my brown sugar and vanilla. I love brown sugar,
you could use regular granulated sugar in your French toast if you want to, I have always
happened to use brown sugar so that is why I use that. And we also need a small splash
of vanilla. This is like the flavoring of things. Now, what you can do is you can really
use any kind of bread that you want with this. Traditionally, you use an eggy bread to make
French toast like a challah bread or brioche. I've got my honey oat bread that you guys
have seen here before and it is just so good because it's sweet yet slightly salty. It's
just - it's perfect. And it absorbs this just beautifully and its been sitting on the - it's
a couple of days old. So, it's a little stale which makes for great French toast. All I
am going to do is I am going to take a couple of slices at a time and I am going to just
dunk them in there and let them sit there for a few minutes until - not a few minutes,
a few seconds on each side. You really want that custard to be soaked up by the bread.
So I would say about fifteen seconds on each side. You let it sit and kind of soak it up.
Now, I am going to do two slices at a time because my waffle maker - the little squares
are a bit on the smaller side. I just make sure I brush it with some melted butter and
this is a heat proof spatula so it's not going to melt. Just make sure you brush it so it
gives you flavor and it also prevents it from sticking, which is always good. But for anything
we just want flavor, right? I'm being greedy here! Shocking, I know. Alright I'm going
to move this closer to me. I just put it down like so. You can see my slices are a bit bigger,
but that's okay. I'm going to close this up and I am going to let that cook until the
light goes green. In the meantime, I am going to soak up the rest of my bread. Can I fit
this in here? Yes I can! Just taking my last batch - oh look at that. They are amazing.
They small amazing. Essentially what you made is French toast but you cooked it in the waffle
iron. All I need right now is some maple syrup and I would be in heaven, but I don't have
any maple syrup right now so this is going to have to do. I don't have it near me but
I'm excited. It's going to be hot. Also, what you can do with the rest of them if you don't
plan on eating them all in one sitting - like tonight it's just my husband and I and we're
not going to eat all six of them or five over there. I am going to - How many are there?
There's five in total, I can't even count. I am going to just freeze them and then when
I want them I just take them out and pop them in the toaster or you can even put them in
a hot oven. Either way, you get them thawed and have homemade, you know, waffle French
toast whenever you want it. So good! It gets like crispy so it's really delicious and it's
not as soft but it's just traditional flavors of French toast but it's got a little more
texture to it and a bit more flare. Laurainthekitchen.com will have the recipe written for you. Let
me know what else you want to see in the waffle maker because there's so many different things
we could do with it and I am going to show you other things you can do using it but if
there's anything you want to see in particular let me know down below. I hope you've enjoyed
spending time with me and I will see you next time. Bye!

title: Make French Toast
content:
Hi! I'm Louis Ortiz on behalf of Expert Village
and today we are going to show you a basic preparation for French Toast. This is a real
crowd pleaser as far as the breakfast meals go. I've got some thick sliced white bread
that I just got from the grocery store and I am using a knife that has some teeth on
it so that we can cut through this bread without having to apply a bunch of pressure to it
and mash it down, so that we get some nice even slices. I am just going to cut these
in triangles here in half. Behind me on the stove top, I have a non-stick Teflon sautee
pan with some clarified butter and we've shown you how to clarify butter in a previous video
and I like to use clarified butter simply because it adds a really nice nutty rich flavor
to foods but it is also a lot more rugged and hardy to heat. It lasts longer and with
this particular procedure it will be real nice. I just got a thin layer if you will
inside the pan, not too much because it's not going to take a whole lot to just get
a nice crispy color on this milk and egg wash. I used 2 whole eggs and a little bit of milk
in my mixing bowl here. I'm going to throw these guys in. Again the cook time is not
going to be a whole lot on an item like this simply because the bread is done, so I am
going to lower this heat just a little bit. We are really just looking for a nice color
out of these guys and I've got a fish spatula that I like to use and this is for more the
general applications such as this. You've got a decent color coming off of him. We are
doing okay on that color as well. Again, using the clarified butter is going to add a nice,
nutty rich flavor to this. It actually provides a lot better color because you've got solids
in the egg for the milk and egg wash. The butter itself is clarified. So you've got
a nice good golden color on the toast. That only took a little over a minute if you will.
So we are going to finish this second side and we will come right back and show you how
to present this on a plate and how to make it look nice for your guests.

title: Make French Toast
content: I why hello and good morning from me to you and this morning I am craving something decadently delicious but also is easy to make and uses ingredients in my very own kitchen so that way I don't have to leave the comforts of my own home or covers so today I'm going to share with you how to make my very own french toast that is stuffed with pumpkin cream cheese spread which is to die for I crave this recipe even more than pumpkin pie itself and that is not a joke at all so what are we waiting for it let's go whip up a batch first start off with a medium sized bowl add 8 ounces of cream cheese softened at room temperature a half cup of pumpkin puree fourth cup brown sugar or fourth cup of maple syrup I like to use both half teaspoon cinnamon half teaspoon pumpkin spice half teaspoon vanilla extract and then combine the ingredients with a mixer until well blended then save it for later in the fridge or spread immediately on your favorite bread I chose two slices of pumpkin print from my previous video recipe spread on one slice staying inside the corners of the bread place the second on top of the first slice of bread and set aside we are now ready to make our egg wash for dipping in a small bowl and a third cup of milk or cream I used almond coconut milk one large egg age dash or one eighth teaspoon of cinnamon and pumpkin spice one fourth teaspoon vanilla extract and stir until the egg and ingredients are well beaten together pour the egg wash into a shallow dish and dip all sides of your sandwich into the mixture I like to let my sandwich sit a little longer that way it soaks up all those flavorful ingredients now you are ready to sizzle up your stuffed french toast spray a skillet with nonstick cooking spray or melt 1 tablespoon of butter if you so prefer turn it on the stove and sit on medium-low heat then when your skillet is a nice and hunt place you're soaked sandwich on the skillet carefully in cook for just a few minutes on all sides or until each side is a lightly browned and the egg mixture is fully cooked when flipping french toast I use two spatulas that way I don't have any problems or end up with a broken breakfast finally place your stuffed french toast onto a plate sprinkle and sit with a touch of powdered sugar and cinnamon and drizzle a little more of that delicious maple syrup right on top yum now you can dive in and enjoy your stuffed french toast with pumpkin cream cheese you will surely impress your taste buds and guests if they are so lucky that you made them about so I hope you enjoyed one of my favorite morning delights I know I sure did and leave a comment below what you like to stuff your french toast with and until next time I hope you have a very flavorful day bye

title: Make French Toast
content: hi I'm Stephanie Dworsky of joy baking calm today we're going to make french toast which is a great way to use up leftover stale bread all you need to make french toast is your bread and then we're going to make a custard so in a large bowl put three large eggs and I'm just going to whisk those till they're broken up and to that I'm going to add 3/4 of a cup that's 180 milliliters of either milk or cream or a combination of the two depending on what how rich you want your french toast to taste will depend on whether you're using milk or cream I like to use a combination of half-and-half and milk and then to that I'm going to add just a pinch of salt and a quarter of a teaspoon of vanilla extract and a quarter of a teaspoon of ground cinnamon if you don't like cinnamon you just leave that out and that's it for our custard now you can I'm using a electric griddle if you're have your temperature set at 350 that's about a 180 degrees Celsius or you could just do it on a frying pan on the stove and have that a medium medium-high heat and then if you have a nonstick surface like this you could just spray with a nonstick cooking spray or you could just use a little I'm going to use a buttery spread or just butter or even oil just put a little pad and butter on there adds a little flavor and then prevents the sticking and then we're going to take the bread and dip it into our custard now if your bread is really stale you may have to leave it in the custard for a little bit you want it to absorb some of the liquid but you don't want it to get like all soggy where the bread starts breaking up my bread is just about a day old so I don't have to leave it in too much but see it's still holding together and just put it on and you can use any type of bread I'm using a white bread but you could use whole wheat rye bread cinnamon bread I mean whatever you like and then all you do is fry it until the bottom side is golden brown and then we flip it flip it now the butter or the oil that you put down does as you can see help with the brownie it's not a solid brown it's kind of speckled and there we go and just cook the other side for a couple minutes okay now you will see the second side never Browns quite as much as the first and that's right and then put on your plate now if we want to do some more then I would put a little more butter or oil on there and then get your bread into the custard you want to make sure that the French toast is cooked all the way through but so you the outside should be nice and crispy yet the inside nice and soft there we go kids really like this for breakfast but I've also had it for lunch okay and now you could serve this with pure maple syrup you could have a little more butter on there see if I'm through that and but another way I like to do it especially if I'm having it for lunch is I like to spread the bread with some jam and then maybe have a little um whipped cream on top that makes actually a very good dessert so until next time I'm Stephanie Jaworski of joy baking calm

title: Make French Toast
content: hey guys thanks to cooking with Tammy today I'm going to show you how to make a delicious quick and easy french toast so with that being said let's get started ingredients that we're going to need are four eggs 1 teaspoon of ground cinnamon 4 tablespoons of granulated sugar a half a tablespoon of pure vanilla extract a quarter teaspoon of ground nutmeg 8 slices of texas-sized toast and a half a cup of milk plus a half a cup of heavy cream however if you don't have heavy cream feel free to use one cup of half-and-half starting with the preparation of our custard I'm going to start by lightly whisking our eggs adding the milk as well as the granulated sugar brown cinnamon ground nutmeg and pure vanilla extract while continuously whisking until all ingredients are combined add a small amount of butter or nonstick cooking spray to the skillet to prevent the bread from sticking using a utensil spread the butter to accommodate the size of the bread dipping each slice of bread into the custard mixture making sure that the bread is coated well shaking off any excess place onto the skillet and allow the french toast to brown lightly before flipping it over when using texas-sized toast because the cut of the bread is a little bigger be sure to keep your flame on low too low medium heat to allow the french toast to cook all the way through after about a minute flipping it on to the other side as you can see our french toast is now golden brown and I'm going to allow it to cook on the other side as well now that our french toast is finished I'm going to drizzle it with a little maple syrup and hit it off with a little confectioner's sugar as always guys thanks for cooking with tami be sure to subscribe to stay updated definitely give this video a thumbs up and most of all guys enjoy

title: Make French Toast
content: to make the french toast first gather your meson plas slice the bread into 1-inch thick pieces and then prepare the batter pour the nut milk into a blender along with a cashew butter maple syrup vanilla bean egg replacer cinnamon salt and freshly ground nutmeg blend until the batter is smooth and then pour into a large bowl this is the consistency that you are looking for place a couple of pieces of bread into the bowl turning them over to fully coat them in the batter let soak for a few minutes to allow the batter enough time to fully saturate the bread next heat a large fry pan over medium heat once hot add non-dairy butter and let melt then drain the slices of bread before adding them to the pan let the bread cook on the first side for three or four minutes or until golden brown like this continue to cook for another few minutes or until cooked through and golden serve with fresh fruit if desired and drizzled with maple syrup

cooked through and golden
serve with fresh fruit if desired and
drizzled with maple syrup

title: Make French Toast
content:
-In our opinion, every good chef needs to
know how to cook French toast and we??re talking about the simple formula for golden, fluffy,
perfect French toast every time. So, what??s the secret? It??s easy to remember. For every 2 slices of bread, stir together
1 egg, a 4th a cup of milk, and half a tablespoon of sugar. Also, keep in mind the bread matters. We??re using hallah bread. Its sweet flavor makes it the bread of choice
for true French toast lovers. Trust us. We??re experts. To start, beat together your egg, milk, and
sugar. Dip bread slices in egg mixture and hold for
10 seconds then repeat on the other side. Heat some butter in a skillet or on a griddle
over medium heat and add your soaked bread slices. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes per side until golden. The key to tell when it??s done? The bread smells a bit and looks slightly
puffed. This means it??s cooked all the way through
and is delicious and custardy in the middle. Serve warm with maple syrup. High 5 your friends. Hug your mom. You??ve mastered the art of French toast.

title: Make French Toast
content: too yummy presents today's special coconut french toast here's what you need four slices of bread three eggs four tablespoons desiccated coconut cinnamon maple syrup or honey now here's how to make it break and beat the three eggs in wide dish set aside desiccated coconut dip both sides of the bread in the egg batter and place on large flat dish sprinkle a tablespoon of desiccated coconut on top of bread slices sprinkle topside only poor a teaspoon of olive oil or canola oil a nonstick ceramic frying pan on medium heat when sufficiently heated place slice of bread one or two slices at a time depending on the pan size on frying pan when bread turns golden brown turn side over about one to two minutes cop the side that's coated with desiccated coconut for about one minute when done clay slices on plate sprinkle with cinnamon and then drizzle with maple syrup pour honey serve and eat warm it's delicious from the first to the last bite you

title: Make French Toast
content:
Hey everybody, welcome to The Take Out Diet. We have come to the 
 place in our relationship where I have to make you breakfast, so stay in bed while we make Burger 
 Kings French Toast Sticks. Here we go. We are going to start by cutting our slices of bread into three sections. This is how we are going to make our sticks of course. Now to a large bowl, we are going to add 
 in almond milk, energ egg replacer, ground flaxseed, agave nectar, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Whisk that all together until it forms a homogeneous mixture. Next we are going to lay our bread into a deep pan 
 and pour our almond milk mixture all on top of it. You want to make sure that those slices of bread 
 get filled up with that almond milk mixture. So turn it around, flip it upside down. 
 Do what you have to do. Lastly we are going to heat a skillet over 
 medium high heat. Add in your butter. I use Earth Balance Brand. Of course I have 
 the size as big as my head. I am American. We have to be patriotic here people. Once your butter is melted. Start to add in 5, 6, 7 of 
 your sticks and let them fry up golden brown as the sun on each side. Once they are done. We are ready to plate them up and eat them. These fried up so crispy. They are so sweet on the outside. Just to start off with, you get all that sugar. You 
 are just like ummm. Agave nectar running down my throat. That is excellent. Then you get the crispiness and the 
 texture of the bread. And you all know I love bread. I love carbs. I love gluten. Sorry for all 
 you gluten free people out there. I love this stuff. It is like Gods gift to me. Personally, nobody else. So you 
 take the bread that I love and add nutmeg and cinnamon and agave nectar and sugar and butter and frying and it is amazing. And this is breakfast. This is setting the expectation of the day so high. Like, what will lunch have to be to top this? What will dinner have to be? And don't even get me 
 started? What will dessert have to be to top french toast sticks for breakfast. Are 
 you kidding me? This is a challenge. But I am pretty sure me and my taste buds can meet it. I think that is it for today. The sugar has me 
 a little hyper and I am talking really fast but if you have any comments leave them below. Video responses are always welcome, and I will see you all tomorrow. Bye.

title: Make French Toast
content:
How to Make Stuffed French Toast. Perfect for a holiday breakfast -- or breakfast
any day. This French toast recipe will will leave you
as stuffed as the bread. You will need Loaf of French bread 1 pt. fresh
strawberries plus more for garnish 1 tbsp. granulated sugar 1 8-oz. package cream cheese
4 tbsp. strawberry preserves 3 eggs 1 c. half and half 1 tsp. vanilla extract 1/4 tsp. grated
nutmeg 1/8 c. vegetable oil Powdered sugar and butter (optional). Step 1. Slice the bread into 2-inch sections and then,
with a paring knife, cut a deep slit along the center of the top of each slice to make
a pocket. Step 2. Wash the strawberries and remove the stems. Cut them in half and slice them, and then
put them in a bowl. Then macerate them by adding the sugar to
the bowl and mixing it in. Step 3. Put the cream cheese and preserves in a bowl
and mix them together until they're well combined. The mixture will resemble strawberry yogurt. Step 4. Spoon 1 to 2 tablespoons each of the cream
cheese mixture and the macerated strawberries into the pockets in the tops of the bread
slices. When the pockets are full, squeeze or press
the pockets closed. Step 5. Combine the eggs, half and half, nutmeg, vanilla,
and oil in a bowl, mixing it with a fork or whisking it until everything's thoroughly
combined. Preheat a skillet to medium-high heat, dip
a piece of stuffed bread into the egg wash for 20 seconds on each side, and fry each
slice for about three minutes on each side, until they're golden. Add a little butter to the skillet to keep
the bread from sticking. Step 6. Remove the toast to plates, sprinkle powdered
sugar over the tops of the slices, and garnish them with fresh strawberries. Try not to stuff yourselves. Did you know The phrase "French toast" first
appeared in print in the _Encyclopedia of American Food and Drink_ in 1871.

Perfect for a holiday breakfast -- or breakfast
any day.

This French toast recipe will will leave you
as stuffed as the bread.

strawberries plus more for garnish 1 tbsp.

4 tbsp. strawberry preserves 3 eggs 1 c. half

and half 1 tsp. vanilla extract 1/4 tsp. grated
nutmeg 1/8 c. vegetable oil Powdered sugar
and butter (optional).
Step 1.

Slice the bread into 2-inch sections and then,
with a paring knife, cut a deep slit along

the center of the top of each slice to make
a pocket.
Step 2.
Wash the strawberries and remove the stems.

Cut them in half and slice them, and then
put them in a bowl.

Then macerate them by adding the sugar to
the bowl and mixing it in.
Step 3.

Put the cream cheese and preserves in a bowl
and mix them together until they're well combined.
The mixture will resemble strawberry yogurt.
Step 4.

Spoon 1 to 2 tablespoons each of the cream
cheese mixture and the macerated strawberries

into the pockets in the tops of the bread
slices.

When the pockets are full, squeeze or press
the pockets closed.
Step 5.

Combine the eggs, half and half, nutmeg, vanilla,
and oil in a bowl, mixing it with a fork or

whisking it until everything's thoroughly
combined.

Preheat a skillet to medium-high heat, dip
a piece of stuffed bread into the egg wash

for 20 seconds on each side, and fry each
slice for about three minutes on each side,
until they're golden.

Add a little butter to the skillet to keep
the bread from sticking.
Step 6.

Remove the toast to plates, sprinkle powdered
sugar over the tops of the slices, and garnish
them with fresh strawberries.
Try not to stuff yourselves.

appeared in print in the _Encyclopedia of
American Food and Drink_ in 1871.

title: Make French Toast
content:
Goooood morning! I'm Tess and this morning
I'm making some French toast. It is quick, easy... you probably have all the ingredients
and it will be ready in 15 minutes. It's been awhile since I shared a
breakfast recipe video so, French toast it is! This is a basic and simple French
toast recipe and you can find the recipe and the list of ingredients in the
description box below. In a flat dish I have two eggs, and these are jumbo eggs,
so if you have smaller eggs you may want to use three.  Adding some milk and giving
that a good whisk. Next, I'm adding some salt, a little brown sugar and you can
use granulated sugar. Not much as I will be drizzling some
maple syrup over the top at the end and the sugar also helps give it a nice toasting
and browning. I'm adding some cinnamon and pure vanilla extract. Giving that
another good whisk to get all incorporated. This recipe will make five to six slices
of French toast. Today I'm using a butter bread. You can use any kind of bread that
you like but try to get a nice thick cut bread. I'm dipping the bread in the egg mixture
and letting it soak for about 5 to 10 seconds. This spread is soft so it won't
take long. The firmer the bread the longer you may
want to soak. You want the bread to hold its form and not fall apart. You can use any pan  or griddle you like

title: Make French Toast
content: [Music] hi everyone its Tatyana from Tatiana's everyday food and welcome back to my kitchen today I'm taking one of my favorite weekend breakfast dishes and stuffing it full of Nutella I'll be making my Nutella stuffed french toast I love to serve it with lots of whipped cream on the top maple syrup and then a nice serving of fresh berries on the side for a really fruity flavor let's get started and I'll show you how to make this amazing breakfast I'm going to start with my simple custard into a bowl I'm going to add in one cup of milk and three large eggs for a little bit of sweetness today I'm using two tablespoons of maple syrup it's going to give us that maple syrup flavor and a little bit of sweetness and now for my flavors I'll be adding one teaspoon of vanilla extract 1/4 teaspoon of ground nutmeg and a quarter teaspoon of ground cinnamon and just grab my whisk and whisk this all together and you want to whisk all the ingredients together until you have a smooth mixture and that's it for the custard that's how easy it is next I'm going to prepare a cinnamon sugar dip I'm going to add 1/3 cup of brown sugar 1/3 cup of white granulated sugar nice generous sprinkle of ground cinnamon and a little touch of ground nutmeg and just toss this all together and now for stuffing our french toast and I love to use thick cut slices of brioche bread and I'm using my knife to cut deep pockets into the center of each slice and this is the brand that I'm using today I really like this one and it comes already pre sliced perfect for making breakfast and then you want to very gently open each pocket up just like that and I've transferred my Nutella into a ziploc bag and just cut off the tip and then pipe your french toast full of Nutella just like that and then gently close that up I'm going to melt a little bit of butter in my preheated pan I'm going to drop each slice into the custard and we're going to give it a nice soaking you just want to let it hang out there until it's completely soaked up and then sprinkle each slice it's a little bit of the cinnamon sugar mixture and this goes straight into the pan and then add in my french toast I cook these about 2 to 3 minutes on each side and then take a spatula to flip it over and let it cook on the other side and look at all that caramelized brown sugar it looks so good and also smells fantastic to top it all off I want to sprinkle a little confectioners sugar over the top and I'm using a tee ball strainer from williams-sonoma I get lots of lots of questions about where I get this from and then top this off with a little bit of whipped cream and pour on that maple syrup add some more fresh fruit on the top there and this is ready to be enjoyed and all I have left to do is dig in and enjoy my french toast I like to serve it piping hot just stacked one on top of the other top it off with this much maple syrup and whipped cream as you want and then enjoy it while it's still hot mmm this french toast is ridiculously good you get that Uzi Nutella with every bite but you also get the classic flavors of the French toast cinnamon maple syrup a little whipped cream on the top and I love the fresh berries on the side to give this dish a really nice fruity berry flavor the perfect finish to all the sweetness going on for your next brunch or breakfast get-together make sure to include my Nutella stuffed french toast on the menu hope you guys have enjoyed this video recipe and I'll see you next time [Music]

title: Make French Toast
content: hey guys am L welcome back to my baking channel today I'll be showing you how to make a custard flavored french toast this is a Hong Kong style french toast and normally they put peanut butter inside but they recently a dim sum place put this custard love inside and it's been super popular so I decided to recreate it for the custard filling your needs and milk water condensed milk and salted butter and some cake flour start off by mixing the condensed milk and cake flour together to form paste and thanks to Christopher who bought me the spoon all the way from the US now boil your milk and water in a small sauce pot then just combine the hot milk and your condensed milk mixture pull the mixture back to your sauce pot and then add in the unsalted butter cook this mixture over low heat make sure you stand right next to the stove and the stir constantly because custard burn very quickly and you just want the mixture come to a simmer and the kind of thickens up then turn off the heat transfer the mixture to another ball and then cover it tightly with cling wrap refrigerate for about 30 minutes now we actually make the finished toast you'll need some bread cus the filling that's cooled some milk and then an egg start off by spreading a generous amount of the custard filling onto your bread put more of the filling in the center then place the other slice of bread on top and then press on the sides to make sure they're sticking together now crack the egg in a white dish and then whisk it together with milk soak your bread in the egg mixture and then let it sit for about a minute flip it over and do the same make sure the sides are soaked as well now pour two to three tablespoons of oil and the saucepan when the oil is hot enough put the bread in the saucepan and then fry each side for about two minutes on low heat a light affair the sides - so it's crispier the internal the heat and cover the saucepan for about ten minutes this will ensure it's hot enough so the filling is running and now you have a Hong Kong style custard larva french toast I hope you guys enjoyed this tutorial if you want to see more Hong Kong star recipes then please thumb this video up if we reach save three hundred three hundred thumbs up then I'll make a whole series of Hong Kong style dessert recipes for you guys thanks for watching upload videos at least once a week so make sure you subscribe to not miss any of them and I also have a beauty and lifestyle channel now so make sure you check that out and I'll see you guys soon bye

title: Make French Toast
content: hi everyone quantumness and welcome back and today we are making such such a cool recipe we are going to cook in a full breakfast in a rice cooker so for this video i have partnered with tiger and they have generously generously provided me with an adorable pink rice cooker to use if you guys watch my cook miss recipes and you'll know that i worked with them twice before to make some other rice space dishes but i thought that it would be so so cool to be able to make a full breakfast in a rice cooker so this recipe was a bit of trial and error if you guys follow me on snapchat then you will know the amount of times that i tried and failed to do this but i have found a recipe that works as amazing and I'm so excited to show you guys so what's this breakfast consist of its homemade french toast of the blueberry maple syrup syrup some breakfast sausages some steamed cherry tomatoes and a ham hash which is made with potatoes sweet potato um two different colors of bell pepper pan and some egg and so if you're having a busy morning or you just don't feel like fussing with breakfast but you want a nice full breakfast this is the perfect recipe for you it is so easy and a ton of this can actually be prepped the night before the French toast might not look exactly like french toast but it tastes almost even better than french toast so let's get started okay so first we are going to making the French toast portion and you can do this whole step the night before if you like so what you want to do is chop some egg bread into cubes and then place the bread in the rice portion of the rice cooker in a separate bowl combine some melted butter egg milk cinnamon vanilla extract and salt then pro-us on top of the bread and mix until the mixture is fully absorbed and so the French toast goes in the area of the rice cooker where you usually put the Reich and then everything else that we're going to making is going to be placed in there to cook plate in this rice cooker so this is what is amazing about this rice cooker because it allows you to cook side dishes as well as the main dish so first we're going to make the blueberry syrup super simple all you need to do is mash up some blueberries and mix them with maple syrup then you want to pour them into a small shallow ramekin or you can make a little dish with some aluminum foil and then place it onto the to cook plates then to make the ham hash play some potato and sweet potato in a shallow bowl and cover it with plastic wrap and microwave them for about 45 seconds to one minute and so you want this to be slightly cooked not cooked the whole way through but just begin the cooking process so that they can cook the rest of the way while they're in the rice cooker then add some diced red and yellow bell pepper some ham and some parsley then season with some garlic salt and pepper then drizzle some olive oil on top and mix well add 1/2 of a beaten egg and start to fully coat the mixture and so what this bean egg does is it adds the eggy flavor without being like this huge amount of egg so it's still kind of tastes like scrambled egg but it's a little bit more balanced in flavor then you want to place this in the to cook plate along with some breakfast sausages and some cherry tomatoes so to cook this set the rice cooker to the cake function and set the time to 45 minutes then press Start the once rice cooker has Spanish cooking remove the took tray and then place the plate on top of the rice cooker pot and using a dish towel because the replica pot is going to be so hot flip the French toast upside down onto your plate and then remove the rest of your pot to reveal your French toast underneath top with the blueberry syrup and serve with some ham hash breakfast sausages and blistered cherry tomatoes and you are done so thank you guys so much for watching I really hope that you liked this recipe I love that you can make something kind of unexpected like this in a rice cooker as well this video is sponsored by Tiger but I genuinely love this rice cooker so much I use it all the time and it's just it's so it's so cool like number one it's pink and number two you can click things like breakfast in it it's so versatile and you can also make cake you can make you can use as a slow cooker even you can make risotto in it there's just so many other possibilities so if you would like me to make some other things in this rice cooker definitely comment below and I can definitely make those and I love you guys so much and I said cookies and a Valentine's Day theme week is actually starting up next week so make sure to check back on Monday for a whole week of Valentine's dippin videos and I love you guys so much and yeah I will see you on Monday bye

title: Make French Toast
content:
- Hey guys, today I'm gonna show you how to make a really
delicious breakfast treat known as pain perdu. Now pain perdu is really
the origins of French toast because in French the literal translation is lost bread or day-old bread. This is a great recipe to make if you've entertained the night before and you have a bunch of
baguettes laying around that you haven't eaten. It starts to turn hard and you don't know what to do with it. This is a great recipe for that. Now, sometimes in France, you'll see this actually served as desert. But here in the States, you know we love our sugary breakfasts, so it's really good for breakfast too. Let me show you how to make it. So, the first thing we're gonna do is cut our bread into two-inch slices. You can go ahead and just set it aside while we mix up the batter. Then, in a shallow bowl,
you're gonna take three eggs, a half a cup of milk,
a tablespoon of sugar, a half a teaspoon of salt,
and give those all a whisk. Now, we're gonna add some flavoring. So, we're gonna add two
teaspoons of vanilla and one tablespoon of orange zest. So, this is where I'm taking it a little bit to the American side and adding some nice orange to it. Here in California, we
love our citrus trees, so I love to infuse this with
a little bit of orange flavor. So, we're going to take those
bread slices that we prepared and we're going to place
them in this batter to soak. Now, here's the critical part:
you really need to make sure that you let this batter
really soak into the bread, especially if you're
dealing with day-old bread, which can be a bit hard. The soaking of the bread is going to actually soften the bread and make it a lot easier to eat. So, I typically will do
about six minutes total. So, you do three minutes on one side, then flip it and do three
minutes on the other side. And then you can go ahead with your tongs and just sort of do the
sides of the bread as well. While that's soaking, we
can prepare our syrup. So, in a little saucepan, you're gonna add two
tablespoons of maple syrup, two tablespoons of butter, and another tablespoon
of fresh orange zest. Just let that all sort of
melt down and become warm, and then you can keep it on a low flame so that it stays warm until
you're ready to use it. Then we're gonna take out
a large nonstick skillet. I think it really works well
with a nonstick skillet. You're gonna put a pat of butter in the pan and melt it down. And then once it starts to sizzle, you can go ahead and take that bread and place it in the pan. And once they start to get
golden brown on that one side, you can go ahead and flip them. You wanna cook it for
another one to two minutes on the other side. And at that point, I
do go in with my tongs and just sort of move the bread around, making sure that all of the crust side is also cooked and brown, because remember you
have the raw egg on it. So, you just wanna make sure
that it's cooked on all sides. Then once they're done,
you can go ahead and serve. I like to place these on a
nice long rectangular platter. Spoon some of that delicious syrup on top. And top with a little bit more orange zest and you will see you will have one beautiful little breakfast
treat waiting for you. I love this recipe because it's
such an elegant presentation that is so simple to do. It's the perfect recipe to
make if you have house guests that have stayed over the night before and you wanna make something really impressive the next morning, you should give this one a try. I hope you try it and let
me know what you think, and I will see you back here next week for a really darling little
idea for Fourth of July. Until then, bye. (upbeat pop music) ♫ I've been holding you up so you know ♫ And the waves are a-tied to the shore

Hey Chef Kendra Here, And today we learn
how to make French Toast. We are going to add some sugar, nutmeg, cinnamon, vanilla,
and salt to this bowl. Now we re going to add a couple of eggs and give it a robust
whisk. Now were going to add a little butter and a bit of oil to a nonstick pan and get
that under medium heat, guys. Let the butter melt and now we are going to dunk our white
bread in the egg mixture and place it in the pan. The longer you dunk, the more mixture
gets soaked in. Personally I don t like it too soaked. You can use any type of bread
you like, it s your kitchen do what you want. So, all we are doing here in waiting for one
side to brown up, flip and brown up the other side. Then you can top it anyway you want.
Fruit, powdered sugar, maple syrup and butter. I always like French toast with sausage. The
link to the recipe is in the description box below. OK, that s about it, Please share this
video guys, and if you want to keep cooking with me please subscribe. You all have a fantastic
day, Chef Kendra is out. Peace.

title: Make French Toast
content: hi it's Rosie from I heart recipes and in this video I'm going to share the best recipe for French toasts so you're going to need some thick sliced bread the bread I'm using actually has maple swirls in it this is the brand that I'm using if you can't find a spread that is completely fine as long as you have thick sliced bread you are good to go now in this bake dish I'm going to crack open three large eggs once the eggs are in there we are going to lightly beat them next we're going to pour in some milk I'm using whole milk but you can use 2% fat-free it really doesn't matter however I do not suggest using buttermilk for this recipe let's add in some vanilla extract and now we're going to add some brown sugar granulated sugar ground cinnamon and some ground nutmeg once everything is in that bake dish we're going to give it a stir and now we just have one more ingredient to add and that is melted butter so again we're just going to make sure everything is well combined and now we're going to start adding our bread so for the bread I added each slice in here for only 10 seconds about five seconds on each side it sucks up the moisture pretty quickly so yeah you don't need to let it sit in there that long if you're enjoying this recipe so far please be sure to give it a thumbs up I would really appreciate that and thank you in advance and now we are ready to cook our french toast so here is my electric griddle I'm going to spray it with nonstick spray if you don't have an electric griddle you can definitely use any pan that you have so I'm going to cook this over a medium heat and I'm going to start adding my toast on top of this griddle don't forget if you want the exact measurements it can be found on my blog I heart recipes com I will leave a link down below in the description box and we're going to cook our french toast until it is nice and browned just like this be sure not to squash your bread otherwise you will have flat french toast and now that it's done we're going to remove from the griddle and we're going to serve so I am going to serve it with some melted butter on top I have a sweet tooth so I'm going to add some powdered sugar and syrup but you can use either or you can certainly leave your toast in hole like this or you can cut it in slices but that's it definitely give this recipe a try and tell me what you think and coming up next I'll be sharing my recipe for homemade banana pudding if you are not subscribed to my channel please subscribe and don't forget I upload every Sunday and Wednesday

title: Make French Toast
content: today on the domestic geek we are celebrating mom with an apple cranberry french toast big mom would thank you your taste buds will thank you everyone will thank you all right so we're going to build this french toast bake in three different parts the first part is going to be the French toast itself and we are starting with just some cubed French bread now I left this out overnight to get it a little dry totally you can skip that step it's fine but I prefer day-old bread and my friends chose I think it absorbs the liquid much better and now we're just going to mix our egg mixture what I have in my bowl are six eggs and then we're going to add a cup and a half of milk and then half a cup of cream now you could do this with two cups of milk if you want to keep it on the lighter side or you could do it with a cup of milk and a cup of cream if you really want to go way over the top then we're just going to add some spices some cinnamon some ginger and some nutmeg 1/4 cup of brown sugar for a little bit of sweetness and then just a splash of vanilla to live it up all those flavors it's going to be amazing we want to get this really well combined before we pour it over our red mixture and the breads going to soak it all in it's gonna be so delicious we want to make sure all of our bread is going to soak up this goodness and that's going to be our first layer of our french toast baked I have liberally grease a baking dish because I will tell you this mixture does love to stick so don't be shy when you're greasing your pan while this is all soaking up we're going to work on our second layer our beautiful cinnamon apples I am starting with 3 granny smith apples you can mix it up a little bit if you want some more tart with some more sweet apples that works too I perform my apples a little bit tart so Granny Smith is perfect we're gonna peel these dice them up and get them into a little bit of a butter bath then we're just going to hit them with a little bit of sweetness to help them break down a little can add some brown sugar a hit of cinnamon and just a little touch of maple syrup because we can because apples and maple syrup are delicious so by frying the apples we're going to give them a little bit of a head start that way when we add them to our french toast baked they'll cook in line with all the rest of the ingredients now I'm starting with about three tablespoons of butter and let that get all crazy now you don't want to leave these unattended because there is a lot of sugar in this pan and we don't want it to burn so you want to keep those apples moving now don't you think your mom will appreciate all your hard work so now it's time for step 3 in our process our cranberry pecan crumble topping we're going to add half a cup of brown sugar to half a cup of flour then we're going to add a cup of chopped pecans oh that's a thing of beauty already and some beautiful gorgeous cranberries they have such a nice tartness to them to that we're just going to add some melted butter get it all incorporated and then crumble it over this beautiful apple french toast concoction like layers of dessert goodness but it's actually breakfast you can also make this the night before and refrigerate it overnight that bread will just soak up even more of that delicious egg mixture can't go wrong that way you just want to make sure you bring it to room temperature again before you bake it otherwise it will affect your baking time this guy is going into the oven 350 for about 50 minutes when it comes out it's going to be so gooey on the inside and then gorgeous and crispy on top oh my gosh this is a work of art and you should smell the house it smells like apples and cinnamon and deliciousness your mother is going to love you all you need to do is cut these into slices top them with a little bit of maple syrup and you have breakfast perfection and be sure to let me know how it goes tweet me or Instagram me a photo of how it all turns out and of course subscribe to the domestic geek for more great recipes just this happy Mother's Day

title: Make French Toast
content: french toast is one of my favorite recipes to make in the morning it's super easy to make and it tastes amazing here's how to make it for this recipe you will need 4 slices of whole wheat bread one cup of non-dairy milk 1 quarter cup of chickpea flour 1 teaspoon of ground cinnamon 1 teaspoon of maple syrup half a teaspoon of fine salt a quarter teaspoon of ground nutmeg 1 quarter teaspoon of vanilla extract and some action maple syrup for serving first cut your bread in half diagonally while the skillet heats whisk non-dairy milk cinnamon maple syrup salt nutmeg and vanilla in a shallow bowl or small pie dish spray your skillet with cooking spray dip a few slices into the mixture and transfer to the skillet cook over medium heat for three minutes flip over and cook for 3 minutes more respray the skillet and repeat with the remaining slices garnish with cinnamon confectioner sugar and sliced fresh fruit I hope you enjoyed the recipe if you did please click the button to subscribe and click the icons to connect with me and on Facebook and Twitter for the full recipe check out my website Noah green cooking calm

title: Make French Toast
content: you well hello guys today we're going to make a staple of everyone's breakfast if they have every couple of weeks and it's always been a favorite of mine french toast and it's not going to be made the traditional way it could be made a solid different way and it's just the way I've always preferred it liked it and I hope you guys enjoy too so please give it a go so to start off with we're going to need 4 eggs 1 cup of milk a pinch of salt a tablespoon of vanilla essence half a tablespoon of allspice a tablespoon of ground cinnamon okay what's a good ol ordinary give it a good whisk too little to get a nice even consistency okay so what you got your mix get your bread I chose an uncut bread so I can make a slightly thicker than normal the key is to not use fresh bread how did we're hanging around for a couple of days just so it goes a little bit stale it'll soak up all these juices all so much better so what's half the mixtures gone then we go on to your next three once these are done i'll be putting onto a baking tray which is right there and what we're going to do with that is put it into the oven at about 200 200 degrees Celsius for 15 minutes what that's going to do is it's going to souffle in a word the french toast so you'll be nice to crispy on the outside and soft and moist and beautiful on the inside okay that's all our french toast seed now I'm going to stick in the oven for 15 minutes and make sure it's always a as always it's a preheated oven and this one's going to add 200 degrees for about 15 minutes just give a quick turn over halfway through so both sides done evenly stick that back in the oven for a few more minutes I'll be done yes once down just dribble with some maple syrup and it's ready to serve mmm that's very nice you taste the cinnamon the Old Spice maple syrup very nice texture so thanks watching up is another episode of Todd's kitchen please subscribe a lookout for next video catch us later

title: Make French Toast
content: hello and welcome to learn to cook calm I'm chef Marc and today we'll preparing French toast certainly stable for American breakfast and for buffets I like to choose different breads depending on my breakfast guests or who the customers are one of the breads I really like to use is Carla or challah bread it's Jewish bread lots of egg and raisins also you can use what they call Kings bread or Hawaiian Kings bread from Hawaii also rich in egg yolk brioche makes a great french toast - brioche bread which is from France the other bread I like to use many times is the holiday bread that comes out during the holiday season the winter panettone an Italian bread panettone as raises in citroen that makes a very nice french toast as well it's a little more delicate because it's soft but depending on the various grades of panettone you can pay from four to fourteen dollars for it and has more citroen and chorazin and raisins and currants it just smells wonderful so really making a French toast you want to have a skillet or I like to use a nonstick skillet I have five eggs I've beaten in this bowl I'm going to add some vanilla that's an important ingredient right in French toast it's a great American breakfast item probably tablespoon of vanilla five eggs have a quarter cup of milk I'm gonna give that a little I'm going to whisk that around in my bowl you can use for french toast and melted butter what many times I like to use butter that's been separated or melted I'll show you that over here as we go to the stove to make our french toast so here is the butter I spoke about it's melted butter in which I had melted the butter and remove the fold from the top and then actually poured off all the impurities and salt that was on the bottom so it's a clear buttery you should say it's clarified butter this gives me a little or I guess insurance should the pen be too hot or I'm rushing making the breakfast for some reason it's nice to cook french toast on medium heat so we heating up the pan I'm going to put some butter two three four tablespoons of butter maybe five and the pan depending on the size of the pan then I have my bit thin but we don't want to soak it too long that's the key with with doing the French bread is that you want it so too long it breaks up and it gets very soggy and the meantime I also have maple syrup that I have put in a double boiler to heat up because I won't have some nice maple syrup to serve on my french toast so they're soaking they soaked up enough liquid nothing's worse in the sense the French toast being dry you won't have that batter in there always place it away from you with sizzling that's a good sign I think I can fit one more in there and so medium heat not too high but you won't have the classic characteristic brown top on the french toast and I'll show you a little a little tip later on as you go to finish off our french toast shake the pan a little bit so isn't sticking when you pan fry things always turn them away from you right so don't splash yourself that's looking nice that's the color we like right at digital french toast color pops up very nice some people have added a baking powder to that but you have to be careful if it doesn't mix well so I would avoid any leavener there's enough leavening agent in the egg yolk itself and the egg whites so let's get that heat up a little bit I've also our earlier toasted up some almonds we'll add that to it I have a nice garnish of orange and raspberry so now it's the color that I like I'm going to turn off the heat and the poor of some of that heated butter that I used to cook just put a few tablespoons in here we have a little egg in the bottom of the pan a little orange liqueur a slice to that for the adults in the audience little red money so we flame that strand money up we swirl that pour that over the top of the pan nice flavor right off the alcohol let's take our maple syrup bring that over to our table we're going to finish off with some toasted almonds since we have grandma yen that the orange wedges makes a nice garnish we will sprinkle little sugar on the top if you want just a little extra I'm the pyromaniac so I'm gonna you know kind of brighten up my sugar a little bit you've got a nice color let's pour some of that heated maple syrup over that it sure smells and looks wonderful so enjoy your french toast today

title: Make French Toast
content: making french toast croissant french toast for mother's day with a Devonshire cream that I came up with the french toast recipe we have ground cinnamon we have nutmeg half and half vanilla gotta have vanilla and of course eggs and then for the Devonshire cream we have cream cheese we have sour cream and we have vanilla and powdered sugar and I mixed out the nice creamy fluffiness and then it's going to be good so if i was going to eat these croissant or serving with with eggs or anything like that i would put them in the oven and heat them up and get them nice and flaky but since we're going to make french toast you know you can leave them kind of soft and you just I like to cut them in half so at home you can use the frying pan just put it on a medium it's a little bit a little bit higher than medium trick is I just don't want to burn the bread you just dip it dope don't let it soak because the croissant will take up too much liquid and I'll take forever to cook see I missed some there you want to just go back and get it and I put it down on the bread side then I let that sit for four or five minutes and I flip it over let it sit for four or five minutes these riddles are set at 350 so if you have a pancake griddle at home that you cook pancakes on you know whatever temperature you cook pancakes on will be just great for the french toast so we'll flip it when it starts to get a little warm so it's still cold so it has to have to cook through you know it's starting to cook through it's a little bit warm so that's you want a nice golden brown so then we put their French toes down we get a little Devonshire cream just spread a little on and if you want more you can always put some on the side and dip and you can put your favorite food you can put strawberries blueberries bananas blackberries really doesn't matter whatever mom wants there you go little powdered sugar of course if you want butter you can put butter on it you can add a little scrambled eggs a couple of sausages and you can present morrow with a nice little meal and there you go croissant with Devonshire cream with strawberries

title: Make French Toast
content: this recipe was originally conceived as a way to use up stale bread today it's evolved into a delicious addition to any breakfast or brunch I'm Rebecca Brayton and welcome to watchmojo.com and today I'll be showing you how to make honeyed french toast now for this recipe we'll need 2 eggs slightly beaten 1/2 a cup of plain or vanilla yogurt 2 tablespoons of honey 1/4 teaspoon of cinnamon 4 slices of bread and 4 tablespoons of softened butter the first step is to combine the eggs 1 tablespoon of the honey the cinnamon and the yogurt and now we mix now the next step is to dip the bread evenly on both sides in the egg mixture now you have to be careful not to leave it in there too long or else the bread will fall apart another way to prevent the bread from falling apart is by using slightly stale bread now we'll heat 2 tablespoons of the butter in a frying pan so we can saute the bread 2 to 3 minutes each side you want to really keep an eye on the color of the bread on the underside when you're cooking it because you don't want it to burn now while we're waiting for the bread to saute we're going to mix the remaining butter and honey to make a honey butter to serve with it now for presentation we can do a couple of things here I've cut the bread into rounds and put some banana in the middle and made a little sandwich and of course we've topped it with our honey butter and here we just basically topped it with honey butter and some icing sugar

thick Texas style bread slices because I really want that luxurious thick french toast look and feel for this recipe now that you have your bread slices sliced up you'll want to just lay them out on a title: Make French Toast
content: hello ladies and gentlemen this is your chef from gurus cooking during vid guess French toast it's a bright sunny morning and I made these today please make a note of the ingredients will crack open 2 eggs to begin with and now we shall beat them to mix them up pretty well time to add in a few condiments 1/2 a teaspoon of salt to taste and something surprising half a teaspoon of sugar and I will beat the hell out of these eggs make sure you beat them so that you receive froth at the top now we'll take a pan and we'll pour in some oil this is vegetable cooking oil you can also use butter instead I'm cooking at a low flame now what we plan to do now is the eggs that you have beaten along with some sugar and salt we'll pour this into a plate make sure the plate is clean and sanitized and now to make french toasts all you have to do is take bread slices soak them only for a second on either side not more otherwise they will break and then transfer them onto the hot hot pan so simple so we'll cook them for 30 seconds on each side first and we'll keep doing this until we receive a golden crust on top of them so once again now cook for 30 seconds say the flame is low after 30 seconds again shift so keep doing this until you receive a golden crust and then it will be time for you to transfer this onto a plate and serve it hot with anything you like I like it with some warm milk or with coffee ladies and gentlemen this is French toast if you really want to relish this you can also pour in honey on top of this gently little or more depends on how you like it enjoy your breakfast have a lovely day every day french toast please make a note of the cooking instructions friends if you like my video please hit the like button below and if you are new to my channel please hit the subscribe button here thank you once again

title: Make French Toast
content: what is going on everybody today I'm going to show you a very simple french toast recipe I've had a lot of requests for this in my past videos in the comments sections a lot of you thumbs it up and so I figured you know why not show you my take on french toast obviously I always like to do my own spin on things classic recipes my own recipes and my spin on this is I'm using a sourdough bread as opposed to sort of like a brioche or a cakey or white bread sourdough tends to be a little bit more dense which yields a really crispy a nice crust on it so that's what I really love about french toast is getting that really you know crispy and try to stay away from getting really egg-soaked bread so really with all that said let's just get in the kitchen start making this french toast and hope you guys enjoy so I'm gonna start the recipe off by making the batter that you're gonna soak the toast in before you fry it the bulk of this is usually just eggs but I like to incorporate milk just so it doesn't have such an eggy flavor also this is a good time to incorporate flavor so I'm going to add a little bit of brown sugar pinch of salt and ground cinnamon nutmeg and cloves just make sure you whisk this mixture very well so all the spices and flavorings are incorporated evenly here I'm just going to cut my bread about 1/8 of an inch thick and this is some sourdough that I just picked up from the market so just put about a tablespoon of butter into a low to medium heated pan start soaking your toast and layering them in the pan and you're going to cook this for about two to three minutes on each side so once your french toast is beautifully golden brown and crispy take them out of the pan and blot any excess fat off on a dry towel just so it doesn't get soggy now all you have to do is just transfer the toast onto a plate make it beautiful and top them with any of your favorite things that you love here is just a little bit of maple syrup and a nice little dollop of whipped cream has a fluffy texture but it's really crispy on the outside and the sourdough just gives it a really you know different twist to it that I really enjoy so if you enjoyed this recipe please thumbs up and subscribe that way you can see all the videos our future videos that I have and please share this with your friends and family and that's why I do these videos and see you guys next time

title: Make French Toast
content: hi I'm Annabel and today I will teach you guys how to make a French toast french toast is very easy to make and a great way to get rid of your sealed bread everyone loves it let's do it together step 1 let's do some reason plus for this recipe you will need bread a cup of milk and egg a tablespoon of sugar half a tablespoon of cinnamon a pinch of salt and some butter for frying you will also need powdered sugar to sprinkle on top step to mix all the ingredients except the bread together with the whisk make sure that everything is mixed well after mixing take a slice of bread and dip it in the bowl so that the bread soaks up some of the liquid don't overdo it the bread might fall apart if you get it too wet step 3 hit the pan with some butter on medium heat yes butter not the fake stuff you're not going to diet today it's healthy tomorrow when the butter is melted put the dip bread into the pan fry until golden brown on both sides step 4 sprinkle quite a bit of powdered sugar on top of your french toast you can also add extra cinnamon sugar and butter this is great now that's how you make french toast a viva la french toast I hope to see you soon for another how-to video and in the meantime stay classy [Music]

title: Make French Toast
content: hey guys today I'm going to show you my go-to recipe for French toast french toast has got a bad rap is an unhealthy food that's high in fat high in carbs and really offers you know protein but my recipe is going to change that and we're actually going to make healthy french toast today so let's get started we're going to be using 2 ounces of vanilla unsweetened almond milk next we're going to crack 3 egg whites if you're using egg beaters this is going to be about 105 grams of egg beaters now we're going to add an eighth of a teaspoon vanilla extract I actually like my French toast to caramelize a little bit so I'm going to add two tablespoons of calorie-free pancake syrup finally we're going to add our ground cinnamon and a pinch of salt now we're going to give our batter a mix your batter is going to look something like this so now that our batter is ready it's time for our bread if you want to save yourself some calories I highly recommend checking out the shovels smart light whiter wheat bread I find this in my local Walmart and it's actually the lowest calorie bread I've been able to find in the stores so hope you guys like this recipe as much as I like this french toast is actually less than a third of the calories of four slices of french toast from Denny's four slices of french toast from Denny's can run you about 126 grams of carbs if you can believe that the macros on this it's one gram of fat 33 grams of carbs and 21 grams of protein oppa help change your view on french toast it can be made healthy if you've tried this recipe please let me know in the comments below what you thought of it I love to hear your feedback thanks for watching
