title: Make French Toast
content: hey guys today I'm going to share with you a fantastic recipe if you are hosting a brunch or have some overnight house guest it is my crunchy brioche french toast with mixed berries it's a fantastic little treat that will serve a crowd and it couldn't be any easier to put together let me show you how to make it so you first want to create your egg custard I think mixing this up in a shallow pie plate works really well because that will allow you to put several pieces of bread in at the same time so we're going to add four eggs and then three tablespoons of heavy cream now you could use milk if you wanted to I find a heavy cream just makes the custard a bit more decadent but really is up to you and then to that you're also going to add vanilla extract and a good pinch of salt then you can just whisk that all up until everything is combined and set it aside then you want to cut your bread so I'm using a brioche loaf but really any kind of thick egg bread would work well for this and you want to cut some thick slices so anywhere from an inch to two inches works well then you're going to take your bread and place it in the egg batter and then you want to make sure that you give your bread a good chance to soak up all of this egg mixture on both sides that will prevent your french toast from being too dry in the center so I would say two to three minutes on both sides and then in a resealable bag you're going to take two cups of just store-bought cornflakes never brands I like that it works follows and you go put it in the bib lock bag and give it a good whack with a rolling pin to create a nice crushed coarse meal and you can transfer that to a shallow bowl or pie plate and they are also going to toss in a teaspoon of sugar and a teaspoon of cinnamon so now you have everything ready to go then you're going to transfer your bread into your cornflake mixture and just make sure that all those cornflakes are kind of covered on both sides and then it's time to roll it up and we're going to add in a pad of butter and once that butter is nice and siblings then you can add the French toast and you want to cook it for anywhere from two to three minutes on either side just until it's nice and golden brown and if it gets too Brown not too worried we're going to cover this with some powdered sugar later and some berries so there will be a way to fix it then once they're all ready you can place them in the oven for just about five seven minutes and I do this for two reasons one because we're dealing with such a thick piece of french toast some egg batter might have gone on the side it didn't actually get cooked in the skillet so you do want to put it in the oven to give it a chance to kind of cook all the egg and the other thing this will do is help the top there's already nice and crunchy get a little bit more crispy and it really only takes about five seven minutes and once your french toast is ready to go you can slide it out onto a cutting board give it a nice light dusting with the powdered sugar you don't want to put too much because remember we already put the sugar and the cinnamon in the cornflake so you don't make it too sweet and then you can cut each slice on the diagonal and then I like to serve this all kind of layered up on an oblong serving platter I think it looks really pretty that way and then you can just place those berries on top and there you have it a delicious crunchy brioche french toast that will get lots of oohs and ahhs when you bring this to the table and then you turn serve this with some syrup personally I find it sweet enough although my kids will argue that fact I do like to eat this with some syrup up to you I hope you guys give this one a try and let me know what you think if you're looking for a real crowd-pleaser on Sunday morning this one is it alright you guys I'll see you back here next week for another quick and easy recipe until then I

Pottery barn Party Planner
How to Make Custard Battered French Toast hey guys it's ryan scott for party planner
with pottery barn I'm showing you some quick easy tricks to make a simple fun and delicious brunch
what I'm gonna show you today is my version of not your mama's normal French toast I'm gonna show you how quick and how simple And I'm gonna call it, custard battered French toast the strawberries, hazelnuts, and a little bit of lavender actually this morning
okay so this going to be a farmhouse brunch we want these to be hearty pieces, one slice of french toast is really adequate
for one person so what we're gonna do is slice these through 
I'm gonna set them on our platter over here, we're gonna make anglaise let's go ahead and turn on our stove top real quick and that's gonna get it ready to go grab a kind of a higher
saucepan a little thick in case it boils over you want to make sure you have a little bit of surface space we're going to go ahead and add some cream here, this is the body
to our anglaise this is what's going to give it  that rich creamy thickness and a little bit of milk inside there too the kicker which is going to be a pinch
of salt a lot of people don't think that you add salt in pastries but this is what's going
to round it out some sugar goes inside there and a little tab of butter in my house a little tab of butter is about
that we add this to the stovetop bring this up, let it melt,
let the sugar melt let the butter melt but what I wanted to show you was we didn't 
add in there. This is a vanilla bean. The vanilla bean's gonna add a really great amount of flavor if you
don't have it vanilla extract is just fine too I have that here but I want to show you real quick how
to go ahead and take the meat all the beautiful little pods out of the vanilla bean
take your knife, your chef's knife, slide it right down the middle of this
vanilla bean I'm cutting right down the middle all the way to the end turn it over, and scrape all this delicious
goodness vanilla pod that you paid a couple bucks for and it's all right there that's the vanilla bean
that's in your ice cream all the time I want to take this gonna put this inside our base over here then slide it inside as our base is getting 
ready to boil so what I want to do is mix it and make sure I get all that vanilla bean and now this has come to a boil
I'm gonna cut this off turn it off and I'm going to grab my emma collection bowl over here from pottery barn we're
going to add our egg yolks inside here and I'm gonna take our delicious mixture, I want to tease like 
a tablespoon inside our egg yolks basically now the egg yolks are saying oh my goodness that's cream, that's cream okay I'm fine with it now and now you've tempered it, now you're just gonna pour the rest of the cream
as you guys can see I'm going a little slow not all at once add a little cream to the eggs, we're delicious mixed together
now let's take this guy put it back into the pot take it back to the stove top, low and slow do
not leave this egg yolk mixture so my anglaise has now come up it's thickened just like this this mixture is creamy,
delicious, and good, and this is what we're going to dip our french toast into. the butter is telling me that it's ready it's crackling
it's ready for some French toast spattered with a little bit of custard we're gonna go dunk, gonna flip it over and go dunk take this put it right inside there I'm not gonna peek you know I'm not going to peek, is because it's going to tell you
the side of the bread is going to start getting a little caramelized the color and that's when it's time to flip it over another trick of the trade, flip away from
you so it doesn't splatter I want to just finish cooking this french toast right on top, and
then we're going to serve it. so we're going to finish off with a little lavender
and powdered sugar little bit of strawberries I added some crushed hazelnuts,
this is a fun, easy, and inexpensive way of making brunch Enjoy guys. Please visit www.pottery barn.com/recipes 
for a printable copy of this recipe.

up to make you french toast and what we're featuring today are the nonstick griddle xavi Musa Kusa stovetop friendly double burner features soft touch handles and is made of aluminum the nonstick cooking surface makes cleaning easy and requires less fat to cook next the Noosa cast-iron griddle is made of pure cast iron and features one flat side for searing and the other side for grilling finally the 11 x 19 inch mu SE electric griddle also features a nonstick surface and a backsplash to reduce splattering on your countertops the drip tray is perfect for unwanted fats and juices and features an adjustable temperature gauge today we'll be using the electric nonstick griddle by you Musa I've set that on medium heat I'm going to start making my fist leches batter for my french toast in a large bowl add the evaporated milk sweetened condensed milk vanilla eggs and salt and go ahead and whisk that with a whisk now for the bread I like to use French bread baguette works perfectly fine especially because it's french toast but you can use almost any bread you want so we're going to go ahead and slice these in an angle just like this and this goes straight into the fittest leches mixture make sure it soaks up all the milk so while the bread soaks we're going to go ahead and take our mixer and use heavy cream to make whipped cream placed a heavy cream in a mixer and begin whiskey slowly add the sugar then the vanilla once it stiffens put aside the whipped cream is ready the electric riddles hot it's time to fry these babies spread some butter on the griddle until it Browns slightly and Ave you're soaked french toast cook on each side on low heat for about 3 minutes per side remember his face then so it will be easier to flip once done serve them with a dollop of whipped cream and feel free to drizzle it with some warm dose of the legend for this leches for breakfast you bet okay folks I'm sure you like this recipe and there are a lot more to be found on a title: Make French Toast
content: hello I'm sue Walker and I'm going to show you a simple French toast recipe without milk you will need a mixing bowl a whisk a spatula and a skillet or a griddle the ingredients are sliced bread of your choice 3 eggs 1/4 cup of almond breeze beverage 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla 1/4 teaspoon of cinnamon 2 teaspoons of sugar a dash of salt butter powdered sugar and maple syrup or your favorite syrup B together the eggs almond breeze sugar cinnamon salt and vanilla until all ingredients are completely mixed together heat the griddle on medium heat brush the top with some butter dip the bread in the egg mixture make sure both sides are completely coated place the bread on the griddle cook on both sides until lightly browned place the toast on a plate serve with butter syrup and powdered sugar and that is a simple french toast recipe without milk

title: Make French Toast
content:
Today, we're going to make a great recipe
for French toast. It's very quick and easy to make. Flavored with vanilla and rum. Let's go! 
First of all, we need to make the mix. It's very simple. 
To start, break an egg in a large baking bowl. Add half of the brown sugar 
and stir until it whitens. Now add 2 tablespoons of 
Negrita brown rum. This will really add all the flavor
to the French toast. I often use rum in other types of cake or pancake mixes:
 the rum evaporates but all the great flavor stays in the mix. Especially with brown rum, which is filled with
sweetness, spices and vanilla. Add 1 vanilla bean. If you don't have fresh vanilla you can use vanilla extract 
or vanilla sugar instead. Ok here are the vanilla seeds. Keep the vanilla pod, you can use it
to make vanilla sugar. Stir all the ingredients. Mixing in the seeds well. Add 250ml/8,8oz of milk, which you can replace 
with a little cream if you prefer. Take 4 slices of stale brown bread. It needs to be stale. 
This is a budget-friendly, economical dish! The staler the bread, the better
 it will soak up the mix, And the softer it will be. -Never throw away old bread.
-It would be a shame. Use it to make French toast or 
bread and butter pudding... Pour the mix into a shallow bowl. Add the bread; and it will start to soak up the liquid. -It's an important step.
-We leave the bread to really absorb the milk mixture. That way it'll be nice and soft. The bread we are using is quite stale, 
so it absorbs well. Take 20g/0,7oz of butter, 
but use as little as you can, since the pan is non-stick. Let the excess mix 
drip off the bread. It's perfect. Place it in the pan to fry. Sprinkle brown sugar over the top. This will make the outside crispy. Lower the heat. It was high until now, 
now I'm reducing it to medium. Fry on high heat on one side only. We have a real, nice French toast. It's sizzling. Sprinkle with brown sugar... to caramelize, by frying quickly again on each side. A taste of childhood. It's a great afternoon snack. 
Kids love it. I bet! Damien, you showed us how to make great
 French toast. -It smells good! 
-And since it's better when it's hot... -Let's eat it now!
-It'll be delicious. I hope you're excited to make
 your own French toast. It's a great recipe. French Toast: 250ml/8,8oz of milk, 1 egg, 2 to 5 tablespoons of brown rum, 50g/1,7oz of brown sugar, 1 vanilla bean, 20g/0,7oz of butter, 
4 slices of stale bread. Subtitles: Agathe Fonvieille

title: Make French Toast
content: my name is slated rushing i'm the chef of Brennan's in New Orleans and today I did a demonstration for y'all showing you our French toasts or pain perdu there's lots of theories about where pain perdu originated from most people insist it's a French dish but it actually goes back to the Roman cookbook abacus where they soak bread and milk eggs and a fried it and they called it pan dulce so I like to do what's known as a creme brulee base which is a favorite dessert for everyone the blend of egg yolks sugar and vanilla we actually whip that together typically we use day-old po-boy bread we take that bread and we soak it in our creme brulee base and we sauteed in butter and I insist butter because butter is better you get that light browning it helps to caramelize with those little milk solids browning we flip it and we take it to the plate we usually dust it with powdered sugar right away and some seasonal fruit I hope you guys will try it sometime you

title: Make French Toast
content: hi my name is Arielle Fierman I am a certified health coach and I love making healthy simple recipes today I'm going to cook up one of my favorite recipes french toast but this french toast is actually made out of brown rice cakes which are gluten free this recipe is also dairy-free and also sugar free as well so let's get started so over here I've got some brown rice cakes I actually chose this because one day I didn't have any bread and I want to use my brown rice cakes that were in my pantry whole eggs farm-fresh are the best you're going to crack them in and you're going to be using about one or two per rice cake so today I'm going to make about three rice cakes so I'll do two eggs over here you can whisk it up with a fork or you can use a regular whisk I like to keep things simple and just use a regular fork mix that up the more you mix it the more fluffy your french toast will be and when you're making omelets as well the more you mix the more fluffy your egg will be then when you want to do is you want to add some almond milk over here all of the conversions all include on the bottom of the screen you can also add a little bit of pure vanilla extract this is one of my secrets when I want to make something sweet but not use real sugar sometimes I just use a capful can just whisk that together once it's all whisked take your brown rice cake and just let it soak until all of the rice cakes absorb the eggs you can let these soak for about 3 minutes so you're going to take your brown rice cakes you're going to heat up your pan about medium heat you can add about a tablespoon or so of coconut oil if you want you can also use a paper towel just to make sure that it's all spread around you're going to take your brown rice cakes place them neatly on the pan so you want to leave them on the pan for about three minutes until they're a little bit crispy and then when they're ready just lightly flip it and then when you're ready just take them off the pan place them nicely onto a plate what I love to do is I like to sprinkle it with a little bit of real sea salt good quality salt that's not going to make you feel bloated this also brings out the sweetness and the food so I'm just going to sprinkle a tad of that and a little bit of cinnamon which is heart healthy great for digestion warms up the body and your metabolism and also brings out the sweetness and whatever you're eating so if you're going sugar free if you're not going to use maple syrup I just like using a little bit of sea salt and cinnamon or of course you can always use some good maple syrup let me taste this I am getting hungry it's smelling like vanilla french toast in here yum mmm slightly crunchy subtly sweet tastes exactly like french toast and like cinnamon toast crunch mmm so good for more recipes and cooking tips check out be well with arielle calm have an awesome day you

title: Make French Toast
content: I am a big french toast fan growing up it was an absolute staple in my house because of course it was really simple to prepare and it's made with ingredients you almost always have on hand all it takes is a little bread some eggs it's a milk what you end up with is a breakfast that is filling and comforting and of course super delicious so today I thought it would be fun to show you three tasty twists on classic french toast that you may not have thought up we're gonna get started today with some amazing french toast muffins these have all the awesomeness of French shows but all the portability of a muffin what's not to like about that these tasty muffins all start with some lovely French breads all I've done is cut it into half inch cubes and then transferred it into a zipper bag then I'm just going to prepare a simple egg mixture all I'm going to do is combine some eggs with the milk a little bit of maple syrup for sweetness and some cinnamon now if you don't have maple syrup on hand not to worry you could definitely add a little bit of white sugar or brown sugar to this those would both work just as well we're going to whisk all of this up until it's nice and smooth and then we're going to pour this mixture into the bag with our bread the drier your bread be better it absorbs all of the eggy goodness so I'm just putting it out there I'm going to close the bag and then shake it up until all of the bread is evenly coated then I'm going to let this sit in the refrigerator for at least an hour but overnight is ideal when it's time to bake my muffins I'm simply going to transfer my mixture into a well greased muffin tin take my word for this one there's lots of snice sugar in here now it's gonna want to stick and then into the oven it goes at 350 degrees for between 20 and 25 minutes these muffins are delicious all on their own but if you want to take them to the next level I highly recommend giving my maple glaze a try it's really as simple as mixing some powdered sugar with a splash of milk and a splash of maple syrup all you need to do is whisk that all up and then you can drizzle it over your muffins while they're still hot these amazing muffins are basically like a combination of french toast and cinnamon rolls they're soft and chewy on the inside and nice and crispy on the outside I promise you you will not regret making them next up today I've got a twist on friends shows that will take you right back to your childhood they're my PB&J french toast roll-ups and they all start with some PB and some J we're going to start by mixing RPV and RJ I'm a purist so I'm using grape jelly here but you can go ahead and use any kind of jam or jelly lick well you may be tempted to use something fancier the best bread for this job is classic sandwich bread in this case I'm using whole-wheat but you could go ahead and use white if you wanted to so I'm simply going to use a sharp serrated bread knife to remove the crust for my bread and then I'm going to roll each piece out using my rolling pin then I'm simply going to spread my PB&J mixture over each piece of bread and create my roll-ups you can do the same thing with Nutella as a filling with some strawberries would be amazing now that all of my roll-ups are prepared I'm going to get to work on creating my egg mixture once again is as simple as mixing some eggs with some milk and giving it all a good width now it's time to get these babies in a frying pan so I've got my frying pan heating up on the stove into that I'm going to add a nice pat of butter once my butter is nice and melted I'm going to dip each of my rolls into my egg mixture and then into the pan they go I really like to rotate them you times during cooking to make sure they're nice and crispy on all the edges and then if you want to make these extra special I've got some cinnamon sugar happening here and then put them on a plate because he's ready to be enjoyed how fun are these for like a kid's birthday party and by a kid I mean a grown-ups birthday party of course I highly recommend serving them with a nice cold glass of milk finally today we're taking things right over the top with some strawberry cheesecake french toast now this recipe is pretty decadent and I would say perfect for a special brunch it all starts by creating some lovely strawberry cheesecake filling and to do that all I'm going to do is combine some room temperature cream cheese with some finely diced strawberries and a splash of vanilla in my stand mixer I'm going to mix it all up until it's nice and fluffy and then I'm going to set it aside and get to work on my bread for this recipe I'm using this gorgeous sourdough loaf you can go ahead use whatever kind of red you like but this stuff was totally calling my name at the grocery store so I went for it using a very sharp bread knife I'm going to start by slicing off a few thick pieces I'm looking for pieces that are about an inch and a half thick because what I'm going to do is use a smaller serrated knife to cut a little pocket into the center that my friends is where my strawberry cheesecake filling is going to go and we hear just me to feed this filling to our bread and then I'm going to get to work on creating my egg mixture since this is a bit of a decadent treat instead of milk we are using I'm also going to add a little splash of vanilla because of course vanilla is such a lovely complement to strawberry we're going to whisk all of this up until it's nice and smooth and then it's time to take these to the stove I've got a frying pan heating up over medium heat I'm going to melt some butter in my pan and then dip my bread into my egg mixture into the pan it goes and I'm going to cook it on each side until it's nice and evenly browned because these are so thick you kind of want to cook them low and slow to make sure they cook evenly when they're ready they are absolutely bursting with yummy flavor and of course just begging to be drenched in lovely maple syrup I like serving them with some super fresh strawberries and a big tall glass of OJ all three of these recipes are total crowd-pleasers so I hope you will give them a try at home if you do give them a try don't forget to tweet or Instagram me a photo because of course I love seeing your kitchen creations and keep in mind that the full recipes are listed in the description box below so you can take a look at them there now if you're looking for more yummy brunch ideas feel free to check out some of these videos and don't forget to subscribe because there is lots more deliciousness where this came from

title: Make French Toast
content: you get your morning off to a tasty great start with our easy french toast ready in minutes and unbelievably good it makes any breakfast feel like a special occasion this recipe calls for smart white with whole grain sandwich bread it has all the goodness of 100-percent whole wheat with the taste of traditional white bread let's begin with our eggs and milk next add vanilla extract a pure and natural flavor that makes this dish taste so great especially when you add a sprinkling of sugar now beat that mixture with a whisk beat it until it's nice and fluffy we want to make sure all the sugar gets mixed in okay now we're ready to heat our pan we will start with high heat and add about 2 tablespoons of oil in a large saute pan heat that up then lower the heat to medium so we can start our french toast give the bread a short dunk in the egg mixture don't leave it in too long where it will tear then add the bread to the hot pan you can cook two at a time and keep them warm in the oven if you're making more slices want to cook them just until the bottom turns a nice golden brown let's take a peek yes is ready to flip once both sides are cooked we are ready to dress them up on the plate drizzle some syrup in a nice zigzag pattern and add your favorite fruit today I have plump and juicy blueberries and raspberries a dusting of icing sugar is your final touch as the French say voila I can't wait to taste it

title: Make French Toast
content: I okay come on you guys time to go get ready hey guys it's lethal now I'm the mother of two kids and if your house is anything like mine in the morning you're familiar with the challenge of the morning crunch there's hair - style clothes - get on backpacks - pack and on top of it all we want to send our kids off with a healthy breakfast now if my kids could eat something sweet every day they would and french toast is their favorite however I really don't want them to get too much sugar in the morning which is why I now make a lighter version of my french toast it was a really easy switch to make and now my kids can eat what they love and I can feel super confident about sending them off in the morning with a good breakfast so here's how you make this french toast it's really quick and simple in a bowl you're going to combine some skim milk a little bit of egg product some salt and a little bit of vanilla next you're going to add in your true via natural sweetener Truvia is a zero calorie natural sweetener whose sweetness comes from the leaves of the stevia plan so it's a great alternative to sugar it's sweet it's simple it's easy to use in baking and all sorts of other recipes so we're going to whisk all those ingredients together and pour them into a shallow baking dish that's easy to dip our bread in now we're going to go ahead and heat up our griddle once it's nice and warm I'm gonna rub it with a little butter that'll give it a little extra flavor and a nice golden brown color for this recipe I like to use flourless sprouted 100% whole grain bread this is a great alternative to your regular white bread it's packed with nutrients and whole grains it's really really good for you we're going to take our bread and dip it in our egg mixture make sure each side gets a good coating and put it on our hot griddle cook it three to four minutes give it a flip and cook it a couple more minutes you're looking for a nice golden brown color when it's all done I like to drizzle it with a little bit of syrup and a bunch of fresh berries my kids love berries so I have strawberries raspberries blueberries and blackberries but you can use whatever fruit you want I love that my kids are getting fresh fruit in the morning such an important part of good nutrition believe me in our crazy morning my kids are happy to sit down to a big plate of french toast fresh berries a glass of milk gives us a really healthy start to our day we've got calcium whole grains fresh fruit so I'm telling you if you're looking for some recipes that your kids will love but as a mom you're trying to tone down the sugar give this french toast to try it's a lighter version of a classic breakfast that your family will love it's a delicious way to start off any day and we'll have everybody happy as they walk out the door you

title: Make French Toast
content:
How to Make French Toast. Velvety on the inside, crisp on the outside,
great French toast is like the delicious love child of bread and custard. Here's how to make it yourself. You will need A large, shallow dish 1.0 large
egg, beaten 2.0 tbsp melted unsalted butter 0.75 c milk 2.0 tsp vanilla extract 2.0 tbsp
sugar 0.333333 c unbleached all-purpose flour 0.25 tsp salt 5 thick slices of challah bread,
or sandwich bread A large skillet and a spatula Extra unsalted butter A wire baking rack A
rimmed cookie sheet 2.0 tsp your favorite liqueur Powdered sugar Maple syrup and jam. Step 1. In a shallow dish, whisk together the liquid
ingredients until they're thoroughly blended. For a different flavor, substitute two teaspoons
of your favorite liqueur for the vanilla extract. Step 2. Add the dry ingredients to the wet ones, and
whisk them together until they're fully incorporated. Step 3. Preheat your skillet at a moderate temperature
for several minutes, and preheat your oven to 200 degrees. Step 4. Dip a piece of bread in the egg mixture for
about 30 seconds per side. Placed the soaked bread on a separate plate,
and repeat with the other slices. Step 5. Melt a tablespoon of butter in your skillet,
and place the bread in the pan in a single layer. Cook on each side until the bread is golden
brown. If you can't fit all your bread into the skillet,
make multiple batches, adding a tablespoon of butter for each new batch. Step 6. If you're serving a crowd, you'll want to
keep your already-cooked French toast warm while your new batch is cooking. Set a wire baking rack on top of a rimmed
cookie sheet in the oven, and place the cooked slices of toast on top of the rack. They'll stay warm without getting soggy. Step 7. Top your French toast with a dusting of powdered
sugar, a pour of syrup, or a spoonful of your favorite jam, and enjoy! Did you know In France, French toast is called
_pain perdu_, which means "lost bread."

transcript.text: How to Make French Toast.

Velvety on the inside, crisp on the outside,
great French toast is like the delicious love
child of bread and custard.
Here's how to make it yourself.

You will need A large, shallow dish 1.0 large
egg, beaten 2.0 tbsp melted unsalted butter

0.75 c milk 2.0 tsp vanilla extract 2.0 tbsp
sugar 0.333333 c unbleached all-purpose flour

0.25 tsp salt 5 thick slices of challah bread,
or sandwich bread A large skillet and a spatula

Extra unsalted butter A wire baking rack A
rimmed cookie sheet 2.0 tsp your favorite
liqueur Powdered sugar Maple syrup and jam.
Step 1.

In a shallow dish, whisk together the liquid
ingredients until they're thoroughly blended.

For a different flavor, substitute two teaspoons
of your favorite liqueur for the vanilla extract.
Step 2.

Add the dry ingredients to the wet ones, and
whisk them together until they're fully incorporated.
Step 3.

Preheat your skillet at a moderate temperature
for several minutes, and preheat your oven
to 200 degrees.
Step 4.

Dip a piece of bread in the egg mixture for
about 30 seconds per side.

Placed the soaked bread on a separate plate,
and repeat with the other slices.
Step 5.

Melt a tablespoon of butter in your skillet,
and place the bread in the pan in a single
layer.

Cook on each side until the bread is golden
brown.

If you can't fit all your bread into the skillet,
make multiple batches, adding a tablespoon
of butter for each new batch.
Step 6.

If you're serving a crowd, you'll want to
keep your already-cooked French toast warm
while your new batch is cooking.

Set a wire baking rack on top of a rimmed
cookie sheet in the oven, and place the cooked
slices of toast on top of the rack.
They'll stay warm without getting soggy.
Step 7.

Top your French toast with a dusting of powdered
sugar, a pour of syrup, or a spoonful of your
favorite jam, and enjoy!

Did you know In France, French toast is called
_pain perdu_, which means "lost bread."

title: Make French Toast
content: hi I'm Stephanie Gallagher the iron ship mom and today I'll show you how to make french toast for this recipe you'll need two large eggs 2 tablespoons of milk a quarter teaspoon of cinnamon a half a cup of crushed cornflakes two slices of bread any kind white weed or even French Italian bread and one to two tablespoons of butter crack the eggs into a bowl add the milk in the cinnamon and whisk together now sit the egg mixture aside and spread the crushed cornflakes onto a plate dip each piece of bread into the egg mixture letting the excess drip off then press into the corn flake crumbs and you want to turn to coated on both sides you repeat with the other slice of bread now eat the butter in a large skillet over medium heat add the french toast pieces and grill for 24 minutes until golden brown flip the french toast over and grill on the other side for another two to four minutes serve your french toast with fresh berries powdered sugar and pure maple syrup thanks for watching for more great recipes just like this one join me at the Iron Chef mom calm

title: Make French Toast
content: We're Adam and Joanne from inspiredtaste.net and welcome to our kitchen. We're going to show you how to make french toast -- it's really easy. You will need 4 eggs - just crack them into  bowl. Measure out a half cup of milk... and a quarter cup of cream... then add them to the eggs. Next, add a teaspoon of vanilla extract and a pinch of salt... Whisk everything together until well blended. Cut eight, three-quarter inch thick, bread slices... We like to use Italian or French bread for this. Also, try to use day-old bread... it will soak up the egg mixture better than fresh bread. Line the bread slices up in a large baking dish...it is okay if they overlap. Then, pour the egg mixture all over them. Move and flip the bread around so each slice is completely moistened... You shouldn't have any egg mixture left. We usually end up making this in batches. To keep the cooked French toast warm... we preheat the oven to 200 degrees F. Now it's time to make the French Toast. Heat a heavy, large pan or griddle... over medium-low heat. Then melt a tablespoon of butter in the pan. Working in batches, transfer a few slices of the soaked bread to the pan... and cook until golden brown and cooked through... this takes two to three minutes on each side. Transfer the cooked French toast to the warm oven while you cook the remaining bread slices. Add additional butter as needed for each batch. Also, if you notice the pan is getting too hot... reduce the temperature a little and watch for the French toast... it may cook a little quicker during the second or third batch. And that's it... Top with your favorite French Toast toppings and enjoy!

title: Make French Toast
content: hey guys and welcome back to crouton crackerjacks today I'm going to show you how to make easy and delicious french toast you know French toast is one of those things doesn't need to be complicated doesn't need any fancy ingredients you know sometimes it's better just to keep things as simple and French toast is one of those things so without further ado let's get this recipe started alright first thing obviously I'm going to need a batter for my bread so what a pie plate here I'm just going to crack in two large eggs and do better than I did and try not to get shells in your eggs no one likes crunchy bits in our french toast I'm just going to crack those two eggs new up high plate and using a fork I'm just gonna break these up a little bit before I add the rest of the ingredients the reason I'm using a pie plate here is for when I go to coat my bread it's just easier to do it on a wide shallow bowl to my eggs I'm going to add in a quarter of a cup of milk you could also use cream or half-and-half if you're feeling it decadent I'm going to add in one teaspoon of granulated sugar as well as 1/8 of a teaspoon or quarter teaspoon of cinnamon just a pinch of salt maybe an eighth of a teaspoon or so and just a quick splash of vanilla try and use real vanilla extract though and using a fork I'm just going to whisk these ingredients together just make sure that all the eggs are completely smooth the milk kind of helps break up those eggs you don't want to need globules of egg on your french toast you want a smooth batter so I just whisk that well and let me just talk about bread for a minute here I am using Texas toast Texas toast is just regular sandwich bread but it is actually kit cut thicker than a regular sandwich bread it's kind of a dry bread crummy bread and these particular slices are about three quarters of an inch thick and that's exactly what you want you want a thick bread for this I'm just using this regular sandwich bread you could use brioche if you wanted to or French bread you know whatever kind of bread that you like I just happen to like just plain old sandwich bread it just it makes the best french toast to me now I've got a frying pan over medium-high heat here it's actually between medium and medium-high I'm going to add in about a teaspoon of vegetable oil as well as just a little pat of butter now the reason I add both vegetable oil and butter is because I like the flavor of frying and butter as well butter kind of has a natural nonstick property to it but the vegetable oil raises the burning point of the butters the butter doesn't burn because you definitely don't want burned butter on your french toast well maybe you do but I don't so that's why I do both and you want to make sure that your butter and oil are hot before you add in your first piece of french toast otherwise your french toast is going to stick and you don't want it to stick and you know when it's ready when the solids the milk solids in the butter start to brown I don't know how well you can see this in the video but they're just starting to turn golden that is the exact time that your pan is ready for your french toast so what I'm going to do is just kind of mix up my french toast my batter mixture a little bit here make sure that the cinnamon isn't you know sinking to the bottom and dump your bread just really quickly on one side flip it over get it coated on the other side let it drip a little bit and then add that to your pan now a lot of recipes for French toast call for you to soak the bread I do not like soaked bread for French toast maybe you do I don't I like my french toast to not be custardy I like it to still be bread in the center so I just do a light coat on both sides and I'm just going to let this go for a couple minutes until it gets nice and golden brown on the bottom don't be tempted to move your bread around you know just let the pan do its work but the heat do its work you know when you're getting ready to flip when the bubbles around the outside get a little smaller and they don't pop so aggressively so go ahead and take a peek make sure that it is nice and golden brown and then you can go ahead and flip it over and cook it on the other side again just cook it for a minute or two just until those bubbles around the outside kind of simmer down and then you can go ahead and remove that off to the plate add just a little bit more butter and vegetable oil to your pan between each slice and continue frying up the rest of your french toast and this mixture using two eggs will do for me personally six pieces of Texas toast which is just perfect for me and my roommate so yeah just go ahead and keep french toasting all of your bread pieces and then you can go ahead and or some delicious maple syrup right over top if you're feeling extra decadent that's the top with a little bit of powdered sugar if you'd like you can serve these with fried eggs and bacon on the side or if you want just like a little bowl of fresh fruit would be delicious but yeah like I said sometimes it's better just to keep things simple and french toast is one of those things so go ahead and give this recipe a try if you do and you like it go ahead and let me know down below in the comments if you like this video be sure to give a thumbs up subscribe for more deliciousness and keep up to date on all my latest videos thanks so much for watching and we will see you next time

title: Make French Toast
content: hi my name is Amy and today we're making cinnamon roll french toast with rolled cinnamon rolls take a bread pan and spray it real good with cooking spray and then I've got my cinnamon rolls and you want them thawed really nice and soft and you can use six to eight i'm going to use about eight today i'm just going to start placing them in my pan you use eight it'll just give you a bigger loaf of bread so I've got eight in here and then you're just going to pinch them together and squish them together and if you do this just right down in your pan then you won't get air pockets or air bubbles when you're slicing for your french toast and your bread needs to rise till about doubled in size and then you'll bake at 350 degrees for about 25 to 30 minutes so I'm going to set this aside to rise and I've already baked a loaf and the great thing about it is you can slice it as thin or as thick as you want for your french toast spray your griddle with some nonstick cooking spray and I keep mine at about 350 degrees and then you just take your pieces and dip both sides into your egg right and your grill then once your french toast is cooked you can serve it with our yummy caramel syrup even some sliced strawberries if you'd like the complete recipe visit roads bread com thanks for baking with rhodes

title: Make French Toast
content: hey guys it's oka welcome to my new kitchen if you haven't seen my latest vlog I moved and I'm slowly settling and in the new place and today I have a fun recipe for you I'm going to show you how to make vegan french toast it's a really easy breakfast idea that is still delicious and indulgent so it's perfect for Christmas morning or any other day for that matter I'm doing this video and collaboration with Chuck from the vegetarian bakers so let's see what he has to say hey everyone is Shake from the vegetarian Baker and after you guys enjoy Olga's recipe make sure head over to my channel to learn how to make these delicious vegan bread Velvets and then rolls the link for it will be in the description don't forget to say hello and subscribe I also have a really exciting announcement I'm doing a special promotion for my fellow containers in December so all the containers are on sale for 20% off no discount code required and the most important part is I'll be doing double giving so usually we give time school lunches to children in need for each container purchase and in December we're doubling it to 20 so this is super exciting again all the details are in the description so check it out let's now get into the recipe to make vegan french toast you will need bread use whatever bread you like just make sure that it's at least one day old you do not want to use fresh bread for this recipe almond milk brown rice flour nutritional yeast almond butter maple syrup cinnamon nutmeg salt and a little bit of coconut oil combine all of the ingredients except for the bread and coconut oil in a bowl and whisk until well incorporated as always exact measurements and directions for this recipe will be on my website at fab lunch com direct link is in the description place the bread and a large baking dish in a single layer and pour the almond milk mixture on top flip the slices a few times to make sure that both sides of the bread are evenly soaked heat a little bit of coconut oil in a large skillet over medium heat place the soaked bread in a skillet and cook for about five minutes on each side until it becomes golden cook the rest of the bread the same way [Music] now the fun part begins place a few slices of bread on a plate and dress it up with your favorite toppings I like adding some vegan coconut whipped cream I already have a recipe for it on my channel I will have a link for it for you in the description then I add some frozen berries which I defrosted for about half an hour pomegranate seeds and finally maple syrup this is heaven on a plate I love making this french toast for breakfast for special occasions it tastes so similar to the original non vegan recipe well actually I think it tastes even better you absolutely have to try it and let me know how it turns out thank you so much for watching I hope that you enjoy this video as always please don't forget to give it a big thumbs up if you did and subscribe to my title: Make French Toast
content: hi guys welcome to my recipe book with me tareka you know so I look forward to Christmas morning all year round because that's the time that I can enjoy a really nice chilled out breakfast with my family and that's the time that I love making my french toast recipe so you know I don't know about you but I tend to overdose on cakes and cookies at Christmas time so which is why on Christmas morning I like to make a savory french toast not a sweet one just to combat all the sweetness that I overdose on it's really quick and easy and I'm going to show you how to make it you'll need some eggs to start with I've got two eggs here huge eckrich opening you know that's the thing you should always have it at room temperature it will cook nice and evenly same for the milk about half a cup of milk that aside now I'm just going to start flavoring it so I've got some fresh coriander I'm going to use a bit of cumin powder cumin powder is jeera powder and India I'm going to add about one tablespoon of dried chives but if you are using fresh chives use about two tablespoons yeah this will give a really nice and mild oniony flavor without leaving that your aftertaste I need to season this pretty generously with salt get a good few grindings of fresh black pepper okay that should be good on the pepper I don't want to overdo it either and now we're going to whisk this we're going to break up the egg and get everything mixed together really well but don't over whisk it you don't want an over whisk custard and that's it we're done with this now I'm going to get on with making the toasts so now I'm just going to heat up this band got some olive oil now since this is a nonstick pan we won't need much oil I just want to spread it around and while that pan is heating up I'm going to get the toasts ready so this is just regular bread that I'm using regular everyday bread but if you want to use any fancy bread you can do that too I'm just going to dip this in the custard so you want to use slightly stale bread about a day old or so not fresh bread because that will break up completely in the custard will just get mushy and disgusted that we've made a slightly old bread about a day old we'll just soaked it up enough and you want to pull it out before it breaks up and falls apart so now I'm just going to put this in the pan which is nicely heated so you wanna place it on medium-high heat and as soon as it starts to turn brown on one side that's when you just want to this is so beautifully brown it looks gorgeous and now you want to let it cook on the other side so now I'm just going to continue slicing up some more bread okay I'm just going to check it on the other side that skipped over yep it's nicely browned which means this first batch of french toast is done add a little bit more oil and just continue cooking so this is my favorite recipe for savory french toast I usually pair it up with some ketchup that's the way I like it but my crew tells me that they like it with some fresh mayonnaise so I've served it up today with some mayo as well so I hope you try this recipe just a little something to spice up your Christmas morning if you like this recipe like this video and share it with your friends that's what you're supposed to do over Christmas right share all the food that's cooked see you next time guys

title: Make French Toast
content: Hi, I’m Francis, the host of this show "Cooking with Dog.” First, let’s make the custard mixture. Beat the egg thoroughly. Make sure the chopsticks scrape the bottom of the bowl to avoid creating unwanted foam. Add the sugar. And stir to dissolve. Then, add the milk and the vanilla extract. Combine all the ingredients evenly. You can also use soy milk instead of the regular milk. Place 2 and a half centimeter thick slices of baguette in a tray and pour the custard mixture over them. Make sure both sides are completely soaked with the custard mixture. Let the bread sit for 3 to 5 minutes. This is Kuromitsu, sugar syrup made from kurozato also known as black sugar. It is rich in flavor and often used in wagashi, traditional Japanese desserts. And now, with tongs, squeeze each baguette and then flip it over. The squeezing will help it absorb the custard mixture quickly. Then, let the bread sit for about 5 more minutes. Now, let’s make the French Toast. Heat the pan on low heat and add the unsalted butter. When the butter is completely melted, place the baguette slices into the pan. A tip to presenting a beautifully browned surface is to toast the top side first. Cover and cook on low heat until the bottom is deliciously browned. Now, flip them over. Mmmmmm. This looks so delicious! As for the other side, cook on low heat without replacing the lid. When both sides are golden brown, arrange the French toast onto a plate. The strawberry looks great as a garnish but orange or kiwi fruit can also be used. Spoon the ice cream next to the french toast. Sprinkle on the kinako, roasted soybean flour. Finally, drizzle on the kuromitsu syrup. Jaaaan! We recommend soaking the bread with the custard mixture for no more than 10 minutes to give the inside a gooey texture. If soaked too long, the inside becomes soggy. The combination of the crispy outside and the gooey inside makes the French toast very delicious. Good luck in the kitchen!

content: today on Nicko's kitchen such a tasty heartwarming dish that's easy to make we're making my french toast bake so this french toast bake is just so amazing so easy to do and perfect for when people are staying over and you want to make something really tasty and very easy for breakfast so just into a large bowl I'm going to be adding in some eggs and to the eggs I'm going to be adding it's brown sugar and the brown sugar really gives it a nice caramelization if you want to use white sugar you can go for that too of course I'm going to be adding in some vanilla extract and I'm also going to be adding in some mixed spice which is nutmeg cinnamon and a little bit of allspice you don't have to do this this is optional but it really gives it a nice spice flavor so just using a whisk we're going to give this a good mix around get everything combined there now that's how mixture done and for this next step it's best to pop this into a Pyrex jug or a container that you can pour so what we've got here is a large baking dish and I'm just placing down some white thick crust bread now you can use a brioche if you wanted to the brioche will be a little bit sweeter so you don't over sweet but if you want to use it that's fine any bread that you've got laying around make sure it's a day or two old it's not too soft and just place it down and this is why I said put the mixture into a jug we're going to just pour over some of the mixture you can see what we're going to do here we're going to be layering this up and pushing that bread down so just pour it straight over the top and then more bread over the top layer it up and continue that process and then lastly what we're going to do just over the top just sprinkle some more of that brown sugar and that will caramelize on that bread when we bake it in the oven and also just a few more dusts of that mixed spice over the top as well now let me tell you that is a real treat now before we pop it in the oven we're going to just pop it into the fridge for about an hour then we're doing that just to let everything congeal and set and all those flavors soak into the bread and just cool down before we put it into the oven you could do this the night before also and leave it in overnight if you wanted to have it for the next day but pop it in for at least an hour into the fridge and then we can bake this bad boy off place into a preheated oven at 180 degrees Celsius for 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown dust with icing sugar or confectionary sugar and serve now all we have to do is get stuck into this bad boy I love this dish I think the simplicity of it is fantastic and like I said it's perfect for when people are staying over you can make it the night before breakfast is ready to go all you have to do is hand through there obviously don't put in the the sugar but instead of icing sugar or confectioners sugar on the top you can put over some cheese it's completely up to do up to you so you could do a savory version if you wanted to but in any case give this one a try it is so delicious you will not be disappointed I guarantee it you

content: hi I'm Amy riolo with sweetleaf stevia sweetener today I'm going to show you how to make a vanilla cream french toast breakfast is the first meal to fuel your day so don't settle for boring this low-calorie french toast recipe is a delicious start to your day start by whisking one egg and 1 cup of milk together in a bowl then at a pinch of cinnamon or nutmeg and eight drops of vanilla cream liquid stevia to the egg and milk mixture and whisk well to combine add a tablespoon of butter to a frying pan and melt over medium heat turn to coat the bottom of the pan next dip one slice of whole grain bread into the egg mixture on both sides until it's thoroughly coated place the bread in the buttered frying pan and cook until both sides are browned finally top with syrup and enjoy with this tasty morning treat you'll never give in to a boring breakfast again you

title: Make French Toast
content: hey guys i'm back with another friday feast video and this one is kind of different now this isn't a dinner this could be a breakfast a snack a brunch a dessert after dinner it can be whatever you want it to be and what I'm making today is the fancy almond crusted french toast it's just a little spin on french toast using challah bread and I made it a few times and the people that I made it for loved it and to keep begging me to make it again and it's like okay but like when you're really good at something you don't really overdo it cuz you don't be like sell out so i only make these on special occasions so i just wanted to share this with you so let's just jump right into this and i'll show you all the ingredients that you're going to need to make this recipe so you're gonna need yourself some maple syrup some strawberries sliced almonds heavy whipping cream vanilla extract almond extract 4 large eggs and some challah bread and you cannot forget the rum haha so you're going to slice yourself up some strawberries it doesn't matter how many you use you can use as many as you want it's just a garnish the food after you're done you're just going to cut off the tops then cut them in half and put them into a bowl now this step is optional since I am legal to drink I can do this if you're not legal to drink don't put any room in your strawberries so you're going to pour that rum in and have it marinate and just take a little scoop of sugar and put that in a bittersweet in it stir it all together and just have it sit there while you do the rest of your meat so I'm going to pour in a cup of syrup into the metal pot to heat up to pour over the french toast after I'm done make sure to have that on low heat so I'm using whole wheat challah bread you don't have to use whole wheat challah bread but that's the one I'm choosing to use and you're just going to want to slice that into 1-inch chunks simple as that now after you cut up your bread you're going to pour yourself in a cup of cream a tablespoon of vanilla extract or a little splash you can do it by eye a teaspoon of almond extract and 4 large eggs just break them up and put them in a bowl I'm just tryin to be all fancy doing it with one hand don't mind me you can do it whatever way you want to crack your eggs little tip you want to poke your yolk so when you mix all this together it will mix easily and you don't want to mix it too much because the heavy cream will become really thick so you want to have a light hand when whipping it together now after you have all that mix together you're going to pour on your sliced almonds onto a plate and evenly distribute it on your plate now you're going to take your bread and soak it into the heavy cream and all that mixture and let it sit for a few seconds so I can just soak up all the heavy cream and almond and vanilla extract now this is my favorite part you get to dunk the bread onto the sliced almonds I like to have a lot of almonds on my bread and you just put it right onto the stove make sure that it's on medium to medium low heat cuz if you have it too high your almonds will burn which you'll see later in a video because of course I messed it up but make sure it's on medium low too low heat doesn't matter how long you have it just keep an eye on it so you can toast the bread to your liking you just remove it put it onto your plate and pour over all that warm syrup all over it so I'm going to add on my alcohol-induced strawberries and once again please be of legal drinking age if you use the rum if I went too fast for you where the ingredients don't worry everything will be down below so yeah that's it thank you so much for watching and make sure to hit that subscribe button and the like button and if you choose to make this make sure you follow me on twitter and instagram so i can see how your food came out so until next time bye

title: Make French Toast
content: today on Nico's kitchen I adore french toast and this recipe is a cracker we're making my french toast so first of all for our french toast we're going to be putting together the egg mixture that we're going to be soaking our bread in later on so firstly just into a bowl going to be cracking in some eggs next I'm going to be adding in some milk also going to be adding in some cream as well of course it wouldn't be some french toast without some cinnamon as well as love the flavor of this of course we want some nice sweetness as well so just a little bit of castor sugar and for me just something that just brings french toast alive I've got some lemon rind that I'm just going to be zesting over the top so just using a fork just give this a quick whisk around and for me that's just a very simple gorgeous way to do french toast I love the flavors in there that zest of the lemon will just bring everything alive the sweetness of the sugar and the spice from the cinnamon for the bread I'm using a French baguette cut into slices but sourdough or brioche work well two into a pan over a medium heat placing some butter dip the bread into the egg mixture for about five to ten seconds and place into the pan and cook for three to four minutes each side or until golden brown top with optional pure maple syrup and then we can get stuck into this bad boy Oh so I just love this french toast it is just amazing I love the flavors through there the cinnamon of course the cream in the milk just give it a really nice texture too and of course that lemon zest is so yummy in this and I love the bread with it it's not too big and you know you can make this in the morning if you got that sweet tooth when you get out of bed every now and again but really cool in the afternoon too with some coffee and really easy to whip up in under 10 minutes if you've got people coming around so please give this one a try you can leave off the maple syrup if you wanted to but I reckon it's a nice addition so please give this one a try you're going to love it you

and for those of you who don't know how to make french toast this will be a good primer for you and for those of you who have been making french toast for a thousand years then you know there's a nice refresher have you ever done it egg nog style we had we buy our egg nog and a half gallons from the the mom-and-pop store where that we buy our milk from which we get in the glass bottles and this eggnog is positively fantastic it's deep yellow color it's very thick and it literally tastes like you're drinking Chavan illa pudding it's just really delicious and it is a once-a-year treat I even like it and Rick usually makes the eggnog face and it's because he doesn't like this strong back hint of nutmeg this particular year there's very very little nutmeg in it and he really likes it so we're gonna use the cup and a half that I have left in the bottle and what you see here is a cup and a half of eggnog plus a cup a half a cup of whole milk that I had in the fridge so that's what we're gonna start with and I'm gonna go ahead and just pop that right here in my pie plate for some reason I always make french toast in a pie dish and I'm just gonna go ahead and pop three eggs in here and I'm probably gonna have extra french toast mix and that's fine I can keep this in my fridge for a day or so tomorrow morning when the girls get up for breakfast if they want some french toast make some french toast all right I'm just gonna melt some butter in my very large iron skillet and I have this set over medium heat and I'm gonna just drop a piece of bread in this egg mixture and I'm take a clean pizza pan I'm just gonna set it right on top this is going to help the center of the custard and the bread cook more quickly and evenly and then we're gonna be able to flip this in just a few minutes so in a couple of minutes like literally two minutes we're gonna come back I'm gonna show you what it looks like we're gonna flip it and then we're gonna finish cooking it off these are toast and the only other thing I'm gonna do because I'm gonna make it snow because it's eggnog french toast you make it a Christmas time right so make it snow with a little powdered sugar you serve this up with some jam some jelly some um maple syrup or whatever it is you like to have on french toast and you enjoy this this time of year it's perfect another great idea for Christmas breakfast or anytime you can get your hands on eggnog of course I hope that you try this and I hope that you love it and until next time happy holidays

title: Make French Toast
content: *hair warning* looks like a choucroute. hey guys, salut! it's Alex. today i'm showing you how to make proper French Toast 3 Ways. Classic, Super Clean and Super Guilty! French Toast is an iconic French recipe but unlike most of them, it's on the easy side! first off, the batter! in a bowl, mix 2 eggs and 4 tablespoons of sugar. a pinch of cinnamon, a drop of vanilla extract and a touch of salt. mix that nicely. i mean, really nicely. 1 cup of whole milk. and that simply is our batter done! i believe with all that liquid, you can make at least a dozen French Toasts. but now, to the most important part : THE BREAD. or as we call it in France : ze bread! so classically, french toast has to be made with stale bread and that's why in France, we are calling it "pain perdu", as known as "lost bread" but you know what? i don't even understand the concept of stale bread. it might be me being too much french,  definitely possible! but i find it rude to let the bread stale on the counter. and also very sad! that poor little boy! come see daddy! come see daddy! good boy! make half an inch or 1 centimetre thick slices out of sandwich bread. soak them in the batter, flip them and again soak them really nicely. they must be significantly heavier! in my opinion, if you make thin slices, you will only get undercooked or overcooked french toast, there is no way that you will get the crispy outside and the fluffy inside. no way! it's exactly like french fries. put a frying pan or a skillet on a medium-low heat. if you cook them on a high heat, it's gonna be faster, of course. but they will be burnt outside and still raw inside. faster? anyone? coat it with a neutral oil like canola oil or peanut oil using kitchen paper. place the slices in and make sure there is full surface contact. usually, you don't need more than 10 minutes to cook those slices. flip them over a few times just to check if everything's good. a minute before the end, sprinkle a tiny amount of sugar on both sides. *LE STUDIO UPDATE* today's update is quite small but very important to me! do you see that? it's supposed to support something! without further ado, *alex singing with joy* this is a reward sent from Youtube itself to celebrate a 100K subscribers on my channel! i don't have much to say but YES!! wee! and second, thank you! okay, back to the video! and that's how you make great french toast. i mean, easy, reliable and most importantly, delicious! there is a thin crispy caramelised outside, but inside it's moist, soft and it feels like a bit of a custard. of course you can use toppings like strawberries and almonds. but if it's done properly, i like mine simple. now to make a super clean and vegan version! replace eggs with 1 banana, and use almond or soy milk and maple syrup instead of caster sugar. last, coat the skillet with coconut oil. you want to be super careful because the toast tends to stick to the pan, even on very low heat! i don't know why they stick to the pan. maybe it's because of the banana, maybe it's because of something else, maybe you know the answer! so if you do, leave it in the comments below. at the end, banana and coconut bring really interesting flavours. inside it's really soft but to be honest, the crust is not as good as the previous one. so it's less indulgent, that's for sure. but at the same time, as it's clean and more lean, it's more likely to fit your everyday diet. unlike the super rich version! this is how you make it. use brioche bread instead of sandwich bread. then replace milk with cream. i know, it's really bad! and use a knob of butter instead of a coating of oil. the result is, of course, super indulgent! really creamy inside, super golden outside! taste wise, that super rich version is simply magnificent! but as expected, it's a bit higher in terms of calories so maybe just keep that version for when you really need it. your hangover, she break up, then you get up and you snap your toe into the corner of your bed! that's where you need it! i hope you like those recipes and if you did, give it a like! thumbs up and share that over your social media using the hashtag, #SPREADITLIKEBUTTER so that i can find your creation and showcase your lovely creations! so as you saw, i don't use toppings that much but maybe it's simply because i did not find the perfect topping for me yet! if you have ideas of great toppings, share them in the comments right below! last, people click subscribe cos i make new videos on sundays and it's most of the time about getting the posh out of french food! like that time when i made a  tarte tatin with sunny side up egg, braised bell peppers, really caramelised. and also a flavourful, juicy cherry tomatoes! but also i make some very weird stuff like that time where i showed 11, yes 11! different twisted uses of rice paper wrappers. many stuff to watch! catch you next time, guys! bye bye! salut!

title: Make French Toast
content:
An Allrecipes member named Bonnie, commented
that "This French toast recipe is different because it uses flour. I have given it to some friends and they've
all liked it better than the French toast they usually make!" There's nothing quite like well made French
Toast. Crisp on the outside, fluffy on the inside
- when the craving for French Toast hits, this recipe will definitely satisfy! To start with, measure a quarter of a cup
of all-purpose flour into a large mixing bowl. Now slowly whisk in one cup of milk. Then, whisk in three eggs, a 
pinch of salt, half a teaspoon of ground cinnamon, along with one teaspoon of vanilla extract, and one tablespoon of white sugar. Whisk this mixture together until it's smooth. Now, heat a lightly-oiled griddle or heavy
frying pan over medium heat. One at a time, soak twelve slices of thick
bread in the batter until it's saturated. and cook each piece of bread, until it's golden
brown on both sides. The key is to have the heat high enough to
brown the outside of the bread, but low enough not to burn it. Serve the toast immediately, with your choice
of topping. Butter, maple syrup and fruit are the traditional
favorites, but get creative with your favourites! You can also experiment with different breads,
as well. Whole or sprouted grain breads, or a really
good sourdough loaf - all make fantastic versions of French Toast. Strawberries are sliced on top of a stack
of Fluffy French toast that's already dripping with maple syrup and butter.

title: Make French Toast
content:
In France, french toast is
eaten for dessert. But in America, french toast makes
for a sweet, and satisfying breakfast. French toast is best made
with thick, sliced bread. Like brioche, halla, or french bread.
Just choose your favorite. First, in a medium bowl,
you'll need to beat eggs, milk, sugar, vanilla and salt
with a wire whisk, or hand beater, until combined.
Then pour your mixture into a shallow bowl. Heat a griddle or skillet over
medium heat. To test a griddle temperature,
sprinkle a few drops of water. If bubbles jump around,
the heat is just right. You might have to grease the
griddle with butter, if necessary. Immerse each slice of bread
into the egg mixture. You want the bread to soak up
the custardy goodness, but without falling apart. Make sure you place the slices
on and griddle gently. Cook each side for about 4 minutes, or until you see that it's golden brown. Serve with a pad of butter,
and drizzle with maple syrup. Sweet, rich and filling, you can see
why french toast is a popular way to start
a day!

Like brioche, halla, or french bread.
Just choose your favorite.

First, in a medium bowl,
you'll need to beat eggs,

milk, sugar, vanilla and salt
with a wire whisk,

or hand beater, until combined.
Then pour your mixture into a shallow bowl.

Heat a griddle or skillet over
medium heat.

To test a griddle temperature,
sprinkle a few drops of water.

If bubbles jump around,
the heat is just right.

You might have to grease the
griddle with butter, if necessary.

Immerse each slice of bread
into the egg mixture.

You want the bread to soak up
the custardy goodness,
but without falling apart.

Make sure you place the slices
on and griddle gently.
Cook each side for about 4 minutes,
or until you see that it's golden brown.

Serve with a pad of butter,
and drizzle with maple syrup.

Sweet, rich and filling, you can see
why french toast is a popular way to start
a day!

title: Make French Toast
content: hey guys it's Joanne from fifteen spatulas and today we're going to make Bananas Foster french toast I totally understand why people want to go out for brunch because then you don't have to cook but I really love making myself brunch on the weekends because then you don't have to put your real clothes on you just cook in your pajamas you can eat your yummy brunch food or like cozy and cuddle up on the couch and this Bananas Foster french toast is so delicious it is one of my favorite things to make for brunch it's bananas cooked and a spiced rum butter brown sugar nutmeg cinnamon sauce and it's topped on a classic challah french toast it's kind of dessert for breakfast but that's what brunch is half the time and this one's definitely worth it let me show you how to make it heat a skillet over medium heat and add a quarter cup or a half stick of butter move this all around with a spatula to let it melt down then add a quarter cup of brown sugar light or dark brown sugar is fine 1/2 teaspoon of ground cinnamon and about 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg I love to grate mine fresh but you can use pre-ground mix this all together to combine the ingredients into a sauce while the butter is still melting peel two large bananas and then cut them into thirds and cut each piece in half through the middle place the sliced bananas into the sauce I like to do it cut side down first and then bring the sauce to a bubble and cook the bananas in the sauce for 2 minutes until soft and then flip them all over with a spatula let them cook for 2 minutes on the other side the sauce around the bananas will get thick and sticky take the skillet completely off the stove so you don't let your hand on fire and add a quarter cup of dark spiced rum then bring the skillet back to the flame gently tilt the pan until the sauce catches that flame you get a nice beautiful flambe let the alcohol flame and cook off which should take about 10 to 15 seconds and then you can turn off the heat the sauce should be very sticky thick and bubbly at this point and the banana should be a deep golden color to make the French toast I'm using challah which is a very eggy bread it's my absolute favorite for French toast slice it into thick pieces about an inch each and you can see how fluffy and squishy the challah is it's also fairly dense which is why it's so perfect for French toast crack two large eggs and a flat dish and add 3/4 of a cup of half-and-half you can get away with milk if that's what you have and then I add 1/2 teaspoon of ground cinnamon we whisk this all together until ingredients are well blended then place the sliced challah into the egg mixture let it sit for a minute or two and then flip each one over for another two minutes to let the other side soak heat a nonstick skillet over a medium heat and melt 1 tablespoon of butter and then add the soaked challah as many as will fit without overcrowding the pan and let cook for 2 to 3 minutes until the bottom is golden brown and then flip each piece over with a Turner it's so golden and lovely and then cook for 2 to 3 minutes on the other side to make sure the egg is cooked through add a couple slices of french toast to a plate and then serve with the bananas and sauce mooned over as your syrup you can dust this with powdered sugar if you'd like and it's ready to enjoy oh my goodness it's time to dig in get some of that sauce on there some of that banana Hey this show would I don't know if you guys have ever had Bananas Foster before but I remember in the past I'd always think that there's so much extra sauce you feel ridiculous eating that sauce by this beautiful but you don't want to waste it but that's why I Bananas Foster french toast is so great because that Bananas Foster sauce takes the place of maple syrup or other types of syrup that we would use like these two things were totally meant for each other well I hope you guys enjoyed learning how to make this recipe and if you did and you want to see more brunch recipes in the future let me know with a thumbs up make sure you subscribe so you don't miss out in any future recipe videos thanks for watching and I'll see you guys next time

beautiful brioche loaf here you want a nice soft bread brioche of course is made with lots of eggs and a little bit of butter you want to cut a nice big thick slices like this if you want an alternative you could use a big thick piece of raisin toast like this this will also work really well with that bread you take a couple of eggs a little bit of milk you whisk it all together and then you soak the bread into that for just a couple of minutes so go ahead and pop that in there into your warm pan you don't need it to be too hot we're going to put just a little butter we're cooking with butter because it's got such a beautiful flavor especially for french toast turn that bread over and just let it absorb some of that beautiful mixture of the egg and milk okay pick up your brioche pop it in same with your raisin bread gently pick it up you might need to use two hands and just drop that puppy in there beautiful now while that's cooking and all you're looking for really is to get some nice golden color on both sides you want it to be nice and crisp on the outside beautiful and sort of silken on the inside now the next thing that I like to do is take some cinnamon and some sugar and just mix those two things together in a bowl and we're actually going to take our french toast out of the pan drop it into the cinnamon sugar toss it before we serve it it's a beautiful way to incorporate a little spice a little sweetness and also give that sort of extra texture on the outside of your french toast now once you've got that little bit of golden color on both sides of your french toast you're ready to go so all you need to do is scoop that up out of your hot pan bring it over to your cinnamon sugar drop it on in toss it in there you see you get this beautiful oh that's so good okay pop that onto your plate a little ricotta straight on the top I've got some strawberries that have just been lightly poached and a little maple now that is not a bad start to a beautiful weekend French toast so easy to make but so so delicious don't mind if I do

title: Make French Toast
content: hi today we're going to be making french toast a super easy breakfast classic so to start off we're going to be using about 1 tablespoon of butter now i'm just going to be putting this into my ceramic skillet you don't have a ceramic skill you can just use a nonstick pan and we're just going to let that melt now to make the batter for the french toast i have three eggs i'm going to put them into our mixing bowl i'm using a really shallow bowl because i'm going to be dipping the bread into here and i don't want to have a big plate area to make a mess now i'm going to be adding 1 cup of milk if you wanted a richer batter you could also use cream we're just going to whisk this get the eggs a little bit broken up now for flavoring so we can have a tasty french toast we're going to be adding about a tablespoon of vanilla extract and then again we're going to add a more flavor about a teaspoon of cinnamon we just want to whisk this to try and get it combined the cinnamon tends to flow a little bit but that makes a really cool kind of texture print on the bread okay so now you're just going to take the bread dip it into the batter make sure both sides are coated and drop it into the pan okay so now we have the French toast in the pan it's been about two minutes and I'm going to flip it over and let it brown on the other side okay and now we have our completed plate of french toast for serving put a few slices on to a plate I'm going to top line with a few strawberries and delicious canadian maple syrup and some whip cream and i have it super easy and quick french toast
