title: Make French Toast
content: hi I'm Claire from the kitschy kitchen and this is 10 second living where i show you how to do practically anything in 10 seconds or less and today i'm going to show you how to make french toast also known as pan perdu and french toast has a really soft spot in my heart for me because my aunty remakes it every time she visits from Australia it's so delicious and the trick with her recipe is she does not hold back on spice and so the way I'm doing it which is what makes it pan perdu is it sort of a two-step method so to make it I have my milk mixture so for that I have about a cup of half and half cup of milk vanilla lots of cinnamon a little bit of nutmeg i'm going to grate right into it about two tablespoons of brown sugar big fat pinch of salt and then i have my egg mixture which is just three eggs and so the trick is i'm going to take my french toast dunk it in the milk mixture so it soaks up all that flavor and then i'm going to finish it in the egg mixture so it gives it this really crunchy golden brown exterior and just to really blow everybody's mind i'm also going to stuff the french toast with cream cheese and apricot preserves from comparte stock latere that's my buddy Jonathan he makes really delicious stuff and so I'm really excited to try this out so let's get started spread on cream cheese and jam to make a sandwich and a bowl whisk together everything but the eggs soaked each sandwich in the milk liquid and then Duncan the eggs cook for 3 minutes aside my french toast is done and it's covered in a ridiculous amount of maple syrup which i think is appropriate so i'm going to give this a try hmm oh yeah it's really good oh my gosh it's intense i recommend splitting it this is a lot of food but it's just so good I mean the sourdough has such a wonderful depth of flavor combined with cream cheese really delicious jam it's all good things happening right now and really really delicious for more recipes featuring this technique check out my blog the kitchen kitchen calm and my new cookbook the kitschy kitchen available where books are sold

title: Make French Toast
content: hi im sue walker and i'm going to show you an egg white french toast recipe you will need a mixing bowl a whisk a spatula and a skillet or a griddle the ingredients are sliced bread of your choice 6 egg whites 3 fourth cup of milk one-fourth cup of cream one-half teaspoon of vanilla one-fourth teaspoon of cinnamon a dash of salt butter powdered sugar and maple syrup or your favorite syrup beat together the egg whites milk cream cinnamon salt and vanilla until all ingredients are completely mixed together and smooth heat the skillet or griddle on medium heat brush with some butter dip the bread in the egg mixture make sure it's coated all over now place the bread on the skillet or griddle cook on both sides until slightly browned place the toast on a plate serve with butter syrup or powdered sugar and that is an egg white french toast recipe

title: Make French Toast
content: hi welcome to show me the CARICOM I'm anuja and I'm Heather and today we're making an eggless french toast now french toast is something that everybody loves at the people who can eat eggs at least but we've had so many pure vegetarians who really want to try it out because it's such a fabulous recipe and they can't because there's really no good substitute for eggs in this recipe but we have come up with something that is very very close and so simple yeah and so delicious you can call it what you like but it is fantastic over here we have half a cup of Basin or chickpea flour and usually this flour is a little lumpy that's why we're sifting it today 1 tablespoon rice flour and a big pinch of baking soda and what we're gonna do is just sift this all together and you're going to add two tablespoons of fine suji or semolina if you have the coarse variety just put it in your spice grinder just for a couple of minutes and you'll have the same thing and you're going to mix this will also add two tablespoons of yogurt and 1/2 cup of water now we have this in a nice flat dish just so we can show you how we're going to dip the bread in but if you want to put this in a little mixing bowl and just whisk it with a whisk that works fabulous and then you can pour it out into a in a flat dish mix well so there's no lumps in the batter so we're making 2 different kinds of french toast a savory version and a sweet version which is the original one right so what we're going to show you is we're going to pull a little bit of this basic batter out into the side and then show you the ingredients for the sweet one and then the ingredients for this everyone so we have a little batter for the sweet version in this one I'm just going to add a few drops of vanilla but if you're using the whole thing to make a sweet version you're going to need about 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla and about 1 tablespoon of sugar for that whole amount and mix it and for the savory version we have salt to taste add 1/2 teaspoon of roasted cumin powder add quarter teaspoon of garam masala and black pepper powder to taste we also have finely chopped green chillies to taste and chopped cilantro leaves also to taste so not only does that look pretty it also gives it that fresh factor to the whole thing and the good thing is about about these this batter is you can taste it because it's not your age you can just you know give it a taste test and if it's ok great if you want to need to fix anything perfect time to do it and mix it really well and if you want again this is completely optional if you want to kick it up a notch add some red chilli powder again to taste one piece of advice I'd like to give is make sure that the sugar melts before you actually start making the French toast because it otherwise you'll just get grains and it wouldn't have mixed in well with the batter and it won't be sweet so that's why we're just constantly mixing it well so that the sugar has time to melt into the batter ready ok so if you have a griddle over here and we're just going to put one smear smile on it for cooking you don't have a griddle it works just the same with a skillet on the stove right one of the things you have to keep in mind is that you're going to be cooking it for a little longer on lower heat because it is Basin or chickpea flour it's not egg so it just needs a little longer to cook so our savory one I'm going to mix it one time before we start the process and we have basically we have bread we've just split it into half you can do diamonds if you want or you can do the whole thing so press in and quickly flip to the other side press in shake off the excess and drop it and if you want you can pick up a little bit of the cilantro leaves and stick it on top and he has a sweet version after a couple of minutes when the bottom is turning a light golden we can drizzle some oil over the top and flip them over look beautiful coating on there and after flipping them we're going to let them cook on the bottom side the underside looks really nice and crispy and golden brown I can pull them off now these are best served right off the griddle so you definitely don't want to make a whole bunch and keep it to the side take them off the griddle answer and use sweet ones so these are ready they look fantastic let's give it a shot hmm we didn't know better my second trust that is so true I think the fluffiness comes from the baking soda even though it's just a little bit it gives it that little you know softness a little sponginess and it's fantastic and a little crispy because of the rice flour also correct so you're gonna have this with getcher chutneys all by itself on the go so enjoy your eggless french toast savory or sweet and join us again on another episode of show me the curry com adding a pinch of spice to your life

title: Make French Toast
content: hi I'm Lisa McRee with the skinny for everyday health if you've ever ordered french toast at a restaurant on a Sunday morning you might want to think again those fabulous French toast platters can have a thousand to twelve hundred calories moolah lard frère Jacques a'right ding-dang-dong but that doesn't mean you have to say au revoir to french toast forever now you can make french toast at home this Sunday it's super simple and super quick and has fewer than 200 calories of play so you can have an encore next Sunday without having to loosen your penta loans alright now regular french toast is made with full calorie bread obviously heavy cream and whole eggs tons of sugar and the real maple syrup but we're going to drastically cut calories by using a few skinny substitutions light bread has only 45 calories of sliced and instead of whole eggs we're going to use a half a cup of liquid egg whites I really like the ones better and the carton they're so easy to use and just a splash of fat-free half-and-half it has just about 10 calories turn my pan on now let's season the egg and cream mixture we're gonna use a little bit of brown sugar you don't want to use too much you're not actually using the brown sugar to sweeten the bread and we'll get to that later with the syrup but you want it to help the bread Brown and then we're gonna use some cinnamon a whole teaspoon in fact I know it seems like a lot of seasoning for just two pieces of bread but because you're taking away all that fat you want to add in a lot of flavor and cinnamons a great way to do it we're gonna add a teaspoon of vanilla because I I think it just has to be there and a pinch of salt not too much but it just helps bring out the natural sweetness of all the other ingredients and instead of full fat butter which would add a couple of hundred calories we're going to use fat-free butter cooking oil it's just flavored with butter not made with butter I'm gonna let that heat up for about 20 seconds while we whisk our ingredients and soak our bread now you want the bread to be really well coated but you don't want it to stay in it too long because it will fall apart on you and see how that cinnamon is going right into the bread it's really going to add some great flavor all right how's my pan doing I can feel the heat I don't want to drop the toast on before it's hot so I'm gonna give it a little test run oh look a little sizzle just ready to go carefully load those slices you don't want them to tear alright and we're going to let those cook for a few minutes to get nice and brown and crunchy on one side while we chop up some toppings we're lucky in California to have strawberries almost year-round if you don't have strawberries where you live just use frozen ones they'll be fine now my kids love strawberries so I always try to have them in the refrigerator as a snack and when I can add them to meals like on top of this dish it's great extra vitamins extra fiber all right check on this french toast and see how it's doing Oh perfect ah yay carefully flip these guys over oh and then what you're gonna do is immediately turn your heat down because you want the french toast to keep cooking so that that egg is cooked all the way through but you don't want the edges to burn you know my kids love bananas too but I'm a little careful with them a whole banana has 100 calories so if you're gonna add it to the French toast just to keep your calorie count in check just use like a quarter seems about right tick these again oh great now I want to show you how they're browning on both sides and the egg mixture weeping out a little bit as it cooks you may have to flip them a few times to get them thoroughly cooked through and keep doing it until they're done you don't want to eat raw egg you'll know when they're finished because they'll be firm in the center but not burned see just continue to flip until they get to that nice color that you're looking for you know I make these just on any given school day now because they're just so easy and they make everybody so happy pretty all right we're gonna put our toppings on strawberries oh gosh this smells so good my whole kitchen smells like better even I didn't use any and the sweetness and the cinnamon flavor perfect alright and just a couple of other things to make this really beautiful breakfast blueberries love them they had them fresh at the market this morning and I thought they'd be the perfect little addition isn't that gorgeous with the red white and blue awful patriotic for a breakfast alright now here's the real skinny secret about this breakfast sugar free maple syrup I know I'm using the person saying don't use anything artificial however this is a cheap that's really worth it real maple syrup has 200 calories in a quarter cup this stuff has 20 I know you do the math Oh perfect and if you want to really show off if your kids are having a sleepover how about dust a little bit a powdered sugar by the way I'm just using a tea strainer good little tip right you just want enough to dress it up but not so much that you jack up your blood sugar and that's it next time you feel like french toast instead of spending $10 or $12 and a thousand to twelve hundred calories on a restaurant version try this skinny version of french toast at home your scale will say merci beaucoup check out all of my skinny videos on this channel and post a comment let me know what you think you

title: Make French Toast
content: hi guys it's Angela Tim Braun Assoc monster.com and today I'm showing you my recipe for yummy and a diligent but quick and easy French toast and this is perfect for breakfast brunch or desserts to begin i'm cracking in a room-temperature egg and so that i want to splash in some heavy cream and this as well is room temperature as well and then a little tip of some good quality vanilla extract you can also make your own with some neutral e based vodka and some high-quality vanilla beans you can source those online and they're super cheap and then a little sprinkle of salt to offset all that natural sweetness that we're going to introduce with some honey actually but before that I've got a little sprinkling of some pumpkin spice and that I make homemade and that will be provided below as well and a little dribble of honey some local raw honey and I love this stuff because it's a natural sweetener will blend that in later and then I'm going to use the zest of an orange but this is completely optional I just blended everything together and just whipped it up with just a whisk and I'm just destined in my orange and you don't have to do this this is optional but I really feel that it brightens everything up and perks up all those flavors as well as enhances and complements them and you don't have to do the pumpkin spice either but I love all those pungent aromatic spices it really provides an edge of warmth to everything and you can just use freshly grated nutmeg or cinnamon if you'd like if you don't want to use the pumpkin spice already the custard base smells really lovely and I'm just using my bread from my fluffy bread video but challah or brioche your really nice options as well you just have to make sure that your bread slices are stale so it really absorbs everything and keeps its shape while it's cooking because I've got my pan preheating and it's going to bubble away with a nice generous liberal pad of butter so after they soap on each side for about a few minutes I'm just going to flip them so they can soak up on the other side as well so to a hot preheated pan you want to add in your butter and just I love the smell of melting butter already it smells really delicious and I can smell the spices from my french toast that are sitting here wafting up and I just love these pudgy eggy slices they're just waiting to be pressed into this butter I can't seem to find my spatula so I'm using a rice paddle so it's wonderful here as well and the orange zest not only perfumes your french toast but it provides a nice little Fleck of color as well I think these are actually ready to plate and serve I'm ready to taste my french toast my only regret in life is that if we made myself two slices so let's see how it tastes and it smells divine and it tastes even better it's soft and pudgy it's soaked up all those multi-dimensional layers of flavor there's a vanilla that blooms that stitches that kind of brightens in the complements everything that salt that kind of offsets and balances everything out and then there's that nice warm that nice edge of warmth from the spice all of it intermingling for this beautiful white eye soap you guys if this is high for your next wrap this French or desert I hope you guys have a great weekend and Justin from this bushy must stop mom and I'll see you at racing fun

content: hey guys what's up is michael from lean body lifestyle here and today I actually have a recipe that I just came up with and I thought I'd share it with you guys it's actually a healthier version of French toast all right now I'm going to go over the ingredients really quick you're going to need stevia and this is just natural sweetener cinnamon obviously two pieces of whole wheat bread some Pam and some egg substitute now the first thing that you want to do is take the egg substitute and put it in a bowl just like this one here alright now what you're going to want to do is take one of the pieces of bread dip it on one side and then flip it over and don't forget to spray Pam in here I just forgot to do that so alright now take the bread and put it into the pan alright so it's been about a minute on this side and go ahead and flip it over now for the cinnamon sugar flavor I guess like I said you're going to use stevia which is a natural sweetener and go ahead and sprinkle a little bit on the top of this and this will give it that the sugar flavor and also add some cinnamon on top of the stevia alright now I'm going to go ahead and flip it again and add the stevia and cinnamon to the other side and I'm going to flip it one more time just to really cook the cinnamon into the bread all right so this piece is done here all right now obviously you're not going to be able to put powdered sugar on your french toast because obviously that's not good for you so what I'm going to do this is optional obviously is a little bit of vanilla protein powder I'm going to sprinkle a little bit on top and like I said this is optional but the thing about diets is you have to be creative and if you get bored with a diet chances are you're going to fail so always be creative with your diet mix it up with different types of food and here you go a healthy French toast so I hope you guys enjoyed this video do you want to follow me on Facebook and Twitter the links will be down below thank you for watching and have a good day guys

title: Make French Toast
content: let's make ham and cheese french toast you'll need eight slices of toast four eggs 1/3 cup of milk 1 cup of cheese sliced and 4 to 8 slices of ham crack your eggs into a low flat dish but the bread can fit in add your milk and then whisk it together next in a skillet on medium heat dip one side of the bread into the egg mixture and then place in the skillet add the cheese and then on top of the cheese add the ham and finally top the sandwich with another piece of french toast cook on both sides for about three to four minutes

for about three to four minutes

title: Make French Toast
content: during the week our mornings are just one big rush I have to get my kids out of the house by seven fifteen so breakfast is usually a quick bowl of cereal a granola bar maybe an apple on the way out the door and that's about it so when saturday mornings come that's like our time that's our family time to sleep in and snuggle and ma join in our pajamas and make a big family breakfast all together and for us that go to saturday morning breakfast is french toast french toast is not complicated there's you know everybody has their own way to make it it's bread soaked in egg and grilled on a griddle I like to use a really healthy 12 grain bread the nuts and the seeds give it some good texture and and it's good for them but they don't really know the difference the egg mixture is just one egg yolk and the rest egg whites the kids don't notice the difference at all and it tastes just as good in the end add my cinnamon in there I pour the vanilla in a little dash of nutmeg you take the bread and you soak it in the egg mixture you want to really leave it for like you know 30 45 seconds on each side you want to make sure it's soaked it if you just quickly put the bread in it kind of sits on top but it doesn't really soak in there you're gonna put the bread down on the griddle for like you know a minute or so on each side you want to make sure it's really browned and golden looking then I like to take it and put it in the oven while the french kiss is warming in the oven that's when I make the whipped cream so I just use some heavy whipping cream i put my vanilla in there a little dash of sugar take the french toast out of the oven I sliced up my fresh bananas pour the sweet stir up all over the top with the whipped cream on top my kids feel like they're eating something super delicious and like a big treat like the joke's on you mom we're going to eat dessert for breakfast it's just a meal that we can all sit around and enjoy together in our pajamas on Saturday morning it's just like warm cozy family time and it's what I cherish most I look forward to it all week you

title: Make French Toast
content:
- Hi everyone. Today I'm gonna share with you my ultimate breakfast sandwich. This thing has a little bit of everything. It's got hash browns, eggs, bacon, cheese, all of that sandwiched between two slices of French toast. I'm gonna get started with the custard. We have six eggs here, keep in mind, that the recipe is for four servings, we're making one today. While you're beating this, you want to make sure that the yokes
and the egg whites are well incorporated, otherwise it comes out uneven while you're cooking it. You could skip this portion and just make your ultimate egg sandwich with just two slices of bread, but that really doesn't constitute it
being ultimate, right? Pour the eggs into the pan. I'm using a shallow dish,
so it's a little bit easier to soak our bread. We'll add our cream and milk. A little bit of sugar. Our cinnamon. And, lastly, the vanilla. And take this and mix it all up. So that the cinnamon is all mixed in. It has a tendency to settle
when it just sits there. Let's grab our bread and get going. For the bread you definitely want to have something that's going to retain its structure when
you soak it in the custard, so go for something that is hardy, it's crusty, not something soft. And the reason I'm telling you that is I made this for the first time, and, well of course I used like,
the softest white bread, right? I put it into the
custard, I pulled it out, and half of the bread was in the custard, and the other half was in my hand. So you definitely want to use something that will hold its shape. Press it down. Let it just sit there for a bit. And we'll flip it. Okay, we'll let these soak
for about a minute or two, you just want to make sure the custard seeps into the bread. Okay, let's get started
on the hash browns. We'll carefully add one in. We'll let that cook, and
we'll have the bacon cook. We're gonna let this go for
about three to five minutes. It looks like our bacon
and hash browns are ready, so let's just transfer
that over to our board. Now we're gonna cook the French toast in the pan that the bacon cooked in. It has all that nice
flavor in there already, so I don't want to waste it. We're gonna have that cook on medium until the underside gets nice and golden. Our French toast is ready, it's nice and golden brown, as it should be. So we'll move them out of the pan. Make room to cook our egg. And I'm using the same pan. This won't take too long,
what we're looking for is something that's across between almost a soft-boiled egg, and
still runny at the center. And you can check your egg
just by tapping the yolk, and that is still a little
bit too runny for me, so I'm gonna let it cook
just a tad bit longer. No breakfast sandwich is complete without some melted cheese on top. Okay everyone, we're almost done. We're going to go ahead
and layer our sandwich. Get your hash brown, put it down. We'll put the egg on top. There's some bacon on there. If you're like me, you
like a lot of bacon. Doesn't that look good? You can see the egg,
it's already beginning to drip out of there. Last part, we are going to dust
some powdered sugar on top. This just makes it extra
decadent, I love it. If you're my husband, you
will pour syrup all over this. That's just a little too crazy for me. Let's cut into this. And there we go. The yolk is almost like a soft-boiled, the way I exactly like it. Okay, now here's the fun part. You guys get to watch me bite into this giant-sized sandwich, and let's see if I can do it without getting food all down my shirt. I'm just gonna enjoy this. Okay, so it looks like
there's a lot going on in there, because there is, but you can see it's
not too terribly messy. I don't have too much food on me. Oh, there is a little spot there. But I always have food
on my when I'm cooking, so never mind that. I hope you enjoyed this recipe, and don't forget to subscribe and leave a comment and tell
me what you think of it. I'll see you next time, bye.

content: my name is Dale Talde II I'm the chef/owner of pork slope there's a little tavern and healthy cereal party I love it Oh eat it all the time I wanted to like have fun with it the restaurants that I own we all have fun with the food I love cinnamon toast crunch I think it's one of my it's one of my favorite cereals so I wanted to kind of have a play on toast french toast cinnamon toast crunch and really make it into a dessert well we came up with his took challah bread we toasted it we steeps cinnamon toast crunch we toasted it we steeped it into cream and milk and then we added eggs to it to kind of make our french toast batter so the french shows batter actually just tastes like cinnamon toast crunch now so we take our toasted bread we roll it in that and then we kind of Gus it in almost a flower of cinnamon toast crunch we wanted to get more flavor into the french toast so if we toasted the bread and it was day-old bread it actually absorb more of this on glaze that we have the cinnamon toast crunch is really making a nice little coating on top of the french toast I like you a little bit more on top so the nice sugar in here really kind of gets a nice and crunchy that's gonna bake for maybeee how about three or four minutes I'm not much of a sweet breakfast person so this would be a dessert for me to finish this a little bit of banana and like bananas and cereal and a little bit of ice cream to be the milk part of the of the dish you want to see cinnamon toast crunch a fingers you want to taste it but to see it they really kind of thing finishes a dish that I let people know that hey this is this entire dish was kind of conceptualized with cinnamon twist on that's really like how I how I just more how I eat cereal like instead of it like a formal like sit down with a bowl I typically this like sip and snack on it so much work

that you see here was purchased from the 99 cents only store except for the ground cinnamon and the apple cider vinegar and let me show you what I've got I have here a loaf of Texas toast bread I like using this kind of bread when making french toast because it's nice and thick here's two slices here which I had already lightly toasted in my bread toaster it is recommended that you use either slightly stale or day-old bread but since I'm using fresh bread I took two slices out and I placed it into my bread toaster and just lightly toasted it set it on the lowest setting possible and just lightly toast your bread so that you can dry it out if you don't do that and you just use fresh bread and just dunk it into the custard later it'll just all fall apart so once you have lightly toasted it let it sit on the counter for at least 10 minutes until it has completely cold and I have some brown sugar here or if you want you can use regular sugar your choice I also have some salt three eggs some butter vanilla extract a maple syrup and some honey and these are to top my french toast later I also purchased a bunch of bananas for only ninety cents okay they're not very pretty but they can be super sweet inside and we'll need some milk as well I forgot to mention that if you can be using slightly stale or day-old bread then you don't need to toast your bread you can go ahead and skip that part x i'm going to make some homemade buttermilk and i have 1 cup of milk hair i'm going to add 1 tablespoon of apple cider vinegar we're just from this here and then we'll go ahead and give this a stir now if you don't want to use buttermilk in your french toast you can always use just rather milk or half and half we'll go ahead and let this sit for five minutes and welcome back to that I just cracked three eggs into a bowl and now I'm going to whisk them be sure to whisk them really well so I'll spend about a minute or two doing this the buttermilk has been sitting here for five minutes so let's go ahead and pour it in with the egg and whisk to combine the two we need 3 tablespoons of sugar and i am using 3 tablespoons of brown sugar today but like i said earlier you can use white sugar instead of you want or you can even combine the two whatever you want to do will work just fine so let me go ahead and add the brown sugar and we're going to let's get and of course if you don't like your french toast to be a sweet then go ahead and feel free to use less sugar that's fine too let's add a pinch of salt and just put it into the bowl add in a tablespoon of vanilla extract and add 1 teaspoon of ground cinnamon it smells so good soon as I smelled the cinnamon it reminded me of cinnamon buns now whisk everything until it's well combined I'm now going to transfer the egg mixture to a baking dish butter the griddle but if you don't have a stovetop griddle then you can just use a Ritter skillet that's fine too go ahead and butter the grill all right that should be good enough so let's go ahead turn the heat to medium and how you know when the pan is ready is when you start to see the bubbles form and it will subside while waiting for the pan to heat up I'm going to dunk my two slices of bread into the custard or egg mixture and just hold it down for like about 15 seconds okay let's go ahead and flip it on over and we'll hold the other side for about 10 seconds and you don't want to over saturate the bread because it will start to fall apart and let the excess egg mixture drip off the bread and place it onto the pan do the same thing with this one just hold it up and let the excess drip off immediately place it into the pan okay and as soon as you have placed the slices of bread onto the hands Amy of each turn your heat down to medium-low will cook both sides so for about six to seven minutes depending on your pan is going to vary and griddle heats and evilly so I kind of got to move my toast around after like every minute or two and you may have to soggy at all it should be thoroughly cooked so six or seven minutes later we'll go ahead and plate these but remember to rotate them every minute or two so you get a nice even browning so while I'm title: Make French Toast
content:
Hi everyone and welcome back to my channel. Today I’m sharing with you a twist on classic
French Toast, this is stuffed french toast. It’s a custardy bread filed with cream cheese
and strawberries, topped with sweet maple syrup. There are endless possibilities when making
this, you can stuff it with whatever you want, or whatever you have on hand. It’s breakfast done right. So if you would like to learn how to make
this, then let’s get started. The first thing we’re doing is slicing some
bread. I’m using just a white loaf, but if you
wanted something a little bit more interesting brioche is the way to go. It’s a very enriched bread so it’s perfect
for french toast. Try to use bread that is a few days old which
has gone a little dry and stale. It will soak up the milk and egg mixture much
better than fresh bread, and you’re usually left with delicious custardy french toast,
rather than soggy pieces that just fall apart. Cut the slices from the middle of the loaf
so they will be around the same size. They need to be about an inch thick or 2-3
cm. You don’t want the slices to be too thick
that the bread won’t cook the whole way through, but not thin either that it can’t
soak up much of the egg mixture. Lay the slices of bread out on the chopping
board while we prepare the filling for french toast. If you would like the recipe for this Stuffed
French Toast it will be in the information box below this video, and also on my website,
just click the link on the screen. For the French Toast filling, place some room
temperature cream cheese into small bowl. Make sure it’s at room temperature as it
will mix a lot more easily and also spread a lot more evenly onto the bread. To sweeten up the cream cheese add a few tablespoons
of icing sugar or powdered sugar to the bowl. I’m using a wooden spoon to combine the
ingredients together, but a whisk will also work. Mix it together until everything is evenly
combined. This should only take a few minutes, the cream
cheese will start to look very lumpy but it should start to smooth out nicely. Divide the cream cheese mixture between the
four slices of bread. Use a knife to spread the cream cheese mixture
evenly across each slice of bread. We want quite a thick even layer, so make
sure it has good coverage. For every person you are making the stuffed
french toast for you need two slices of bread as they will be sandwiched together. This recipe will serve 2 people but it can
be easily doubled to serve more. A quick fact about french toast, it’s not
actually french, it wasn’t created in France, nor was the person who created it french. The name just comes from a chef named Joseph
French. It was created as a way to revive stale old
bread that otherwise would have been wasted, and today it’s turned into a popular breakfast
food. Along with the cream cheese I’m stuffing
the french toast with strawberries. If these aren’t in season where you live,
you can use any type of frozen berries, just defrost them before you use them and they
will work perfectly. I’m slicing the strawberries into quite
thin slices, you don’t want thick slices, as this will be quite bulky and therefore
stop the two slices of bread sticking together easily. Place the thinly sliced strawberries into
a single layer onto two of the slices of the bread. They can overlap a small amount like I’m
doing here, just don’t make more than one layer. The remaining two slices of bread won’t
need any strawberries as they will be placed on top, creating a sandwich. Make sure to leave a small gap around the
edge of the bread so it is just the cream cheese mixture . When the French Toast is
cooked the cream cheese will melt and create a glue that will hold the two slices of bread
together. Pick up the slices of bread without the strawberries
and place it on top to create the sandwiches. Press down on the bread to make sure it has
stuck together and the strawberries aren’t going to just fall out. Set the bread to the side. In a clean bowl we’re making the French
Toast mixture to dip the bread into. Crack in two good quality free range eggs. Measure out a cup of milk and pour into the
bowl with eggs. Here is a good time to add any type of flavouring
you would like to the French Toast, one of my favourite things to add is a sprinkle of
cinnamon. Or you can just leave it plane like I did
here. Use a fork to beat the ingredients together
until they are well combined. This bowl is a little too small to dip the
bread into so I’m pouring the egg mixture into a shallow dish that is large enough to
fit the bread. It’s easier to pour it into a dish as the
bread can sit flat and soak up the mixture. Place in one of the sandwiches and leave for
a minute or so to soak up some of the liquid. While waiting for the bread place a medium
sized fry pan over medium heat and add a small amount of butter to the pan to melt. Turn the bread over carefully, not letting
the slices of bread fall apart and leave for a further minute to soak up on the opposite
side. Remove the bread from the dish and place it
into the hot fry pan. Cook the french toast for about 4 minutes,
checking the bottom occasionally that it’s not burning. It will be ready to to flip when the bottom
has crisped up and is golden brown. To flip the french toast use a spatula. Since there was a gap left around the edge
from the strawberries the French Toast should be properly stuck together. Cook for a further 4 minutes or until nicely
golden brown. Remove the French Toast from the fry pan and
place on a chopping board to slice. Repeat with the remaining French Toast. Cut the toast in half and place onto a plate. Sprinkle with icing sugar or powdered sugar,
drizzle with maple syrup and enjoy. This is a fun and interesting way to make
Classic french toast a little more interesting. There are endless possibilities of what you
could stuff the toast with. Banana and Chocolate is an amazing mix. If you make this dish send me a photo on my
social media, I love seeing your recreations. Leave any recipe requests in the comments
below. If you would like to see other brunch recipes
take a look at this Eggs Benedict video. I hope you enjoyed this recipe, thank you
for watching and I will see you in my next video. Bye.

title: Make French Toast
content:
Layer two slices of bread with the ham , apple, and cheese, and top with the sandwich with the remaining bread. Whisk the eggs with maple
syrup, the milk, and salt. Once the purple indicator light has stopped flashing dip each sandwich into the milk mixture for five or until lightly saturated.seconds Cook until the
indicator light has changed to red. Then serve with additional maple syrup on the side.

title: Make French Toast
content:
Hello everyone welcome to my virgin kitchen
I am in my in laws house which is very strange indeed thats all im going to say its abit
weird and theres a lovely picture of our wedding a little montage to the side of me. Your not
on your own though I am here. Yeah Mrs Barry is here I havent broken in yeah we are just
doing our voice overs cos the house is quite noisy. Today this is a red velvet French toast
absolutely gorgeous its got a lovely vanilla bean cream cheese filling and its red so thats
romantic isnt it. Erh we are doing some valentines recipes we just did the hidden heart cupcakes
the other day and heres another one for you to be inspired by and complete your valentines
day. If you want to know how to do it all the recipe ingredients method all that bits
and bobs are on myvirginkitchen.com and this is how we did it. Of course you could make
this French toast which Mrs Barry refers to as eggy bread which is quite the British term
for it right you could make this without the gorgeous cream cheese filing which turns that
flavour up to 11 you are gonna love it. In a mixing bowl with some cream cheese in there
just simply add in some sugar and a little bit of vanilla extract just give it a tini
bit of vanilla spank there and it really does taste it right at the end. Give it a good
old beat together make sure that sugar is fully dissolved in there and for the time
being just sit it in the fridge it will just firm it up. Next we are going to make our
randomly very red ergh coating for the bread so in to a bowl combine together two eggs
so crack them in there I did crack a little bit of shell in there I should definitely
use some of my gadgets one of these days. Then pour in your buttermilk add a little
bit of sugar then drop in some more vanilla proper vanilla vibe going through this recipe
and then some cocoa powder. Now beat that together its going to be a bit powdery at
first we really want to whisk it up as well as you can just to make sure all of that cocoa
powder is dissolved through you dont want it being all clumpy alright its really really
important. And I know what your thinking you are looking at that thinking thats quite brown
how are we going to make that rouge my friends. We are going to add some food colouring you
are going to need quite a bit but it is up to you could do the shade of red 50 shades
of red no uh that you want to do ok so add as much food colouring I used actually a whole
little tiny gel tube to get the right vibrant colour in there and with that done its ready
for cooking. So first I wanted to try it in a frying pan where you dunk your bread in
and I didnt lubricate the pan I got it warm I thought oh we are just going to flash fry
this and see if it works dont do that ok because it leaves a bit of a bready residue in your
pan. So what you do want to do is get your frying pan and a little bit of spray oil or
butter if your feeling a little bit cheeky. Just melt that in there then shove in your
dumped bread and maybe about two and half minutes on medium heat is all it needs just
to initially char it and flip it over repeat both sides. Now its completely optional if
you do completely char it up um you can just cover it with icing sugar anyways you know
most eggy bread is quite charred anyway. But as you see when I rested it down it did make
quite a difference in deed. So all that�s left to do now s grab our chilled cream cheese
filling from the fridge and wedge it between two slices of bread you can just have it like
that as it is it will be gorgeous but no we finish it off with some chocolate sauce another
dollop of cream cheese on top and of course the token sprinkling of icing sugar all over.
And then we are sliced into triangles it looks absolutely gorgeous to as it was like a valentines
day treat I did give Mrs Barry the treat of eating it and I think you enjoyed it right
I did it was delicious hopefully the face on the camera right now shows that I did have
a nibble too. Absolutely gorgeous I tell you I mean you can really taste the cocoa powder
the smell when you cook it and there is that vanilla vibe going through it um maybe serve
it with some fruit if you want to zing it up a tini bit more but trust me it�s a nice
little valentines day treat. So that�s it folks nice easy recipe dont forget to check
out Mrs Barrys hidden cupcake recipe with hearts in there and theres loads more valentines
day inspiration over on myvirginkitchen.com so dont forget to subscribe for regularly
videos follow us on social media for behind the scenes bits and bobs and we will see you
again next time.

title: Make French Toast
content: hi I'm chef Susie with learn to cook calm today I'm going to be making a french toast breakfast casserole it's a very easy to do I just have a few simple ingredients and the effects are wonderful you can serve it for breakfast in the morning and what's nice is you can assemble it let it set put it in the oven and you don't have to worry about it there's really not much work after you put it in the pan and it's also nice for maybe a Sunday brunch or even a holiday brunch especially Christmas time it's got some nice cinnamon and not make flavors in it so knowing that let's get started I've got some French bread cut up in slices and I'm just going to line my pan or my casserole dish which I was sprayed with a nonstick spray so I'm just going to line this pan with the bride and if you don't want to use French bread you can use another bread a raisin bread would be really nice or even whatever breads you have leftover will work too if they're beginning to get a little bit stale it's always a good thing to make with something like that so go ahead and fill your pan in very good with the bread and you can even sprinkle some raisins in here too if you like if it's something that you like so I've got my pan line perfectly and I've got my sugar and my nutmeg and my cinnamon in the bowl here and I'm just going to add my whole eggs and i'm using eggland's best organic eggs it's a guy really like to use very fond of it they're all so nice and brown in color too they have nice brown shell so as soon as my eggs are incorporated I'm going to be adding my half and half cream and then this is going to be the liquid that we pour over the bread in the pan so you want to make sure that your eggs are mixed in really well so you don't get any clumps of egg in there when it's cooking hey so I've got my Dean's half in half I'm going to be adding the first half and I'm going to mix it in then add the second half so it's just really a basic Aegon cinnamon mixture which them sugar and half and half in it so now that my mixture is well incorporated I'm just going to be pouring it over my bride in my pan and I'm going to put this in the refrigerator for 30 minutes so it can soak in and you can even make this the night before and let it soak overnight and then just pop it in the fridge in the morning if you have any little egg pieces on top go ahead and blend them in I kind of like to push everything down a bit too so my mixture is ready I'm going to cover it and put it in the refrigerator for 30 minutes so we can soak up all the liquid and then I'm going to be baking this at 400 degrees for 35 to 40 minutes now that the casserole is nicely baked it's firmed the eggs are cooked all the way through I inserted a knife in the center a small paring knife to check to make sure the eggs were done it came out clean that means they're done I baked it at 400 degrees for about 35 to 40 minutes and I'm just going to sprinkle a little bit of cinnamon sugar on top because I like mine just a little more cinnamony it's whatever you like then I'm going to dust the top with some powdered sugar just so it looks finished and I had some raspberries in my refrigerator so I'm just going to sprinkle some raspberries on top for some different color orange slices would also look very nice or you can just leave it plain blueberries would look nice too and maybe some blackberries but just adding a little bit of extra color and it's ready to go out on a buffet or even sit on your kitchen counter and your family can spoon it out or you can cut it and put it on plates for that so thanks for joining me today it learn to cook calm well thanks for joining us today at learn to cook calm be sure to comment and to subscribe also visit us on Facebook and Twitter have a great day and thank you

Yeah, it's a sweet dish but salt helps your tongue taste.  It opens up your tongue for receiving flavors so if you have a little bit of salt in your dishes it makes them tasty!  You shouldn't taste salt, you should taste flavors! Optional vanilla extract. Non-optional cinnamon A spoonful!  Half a spoonful? Once you've got your cinnamony delicious custard mixed together, pour it in a flat bowl.  If I'm cooking eggs, I'm using my Teflon pan. The secret to using teflon: heat it up first.  Get it good and hot and then add your butter. I like to put my custard in a in a pie pan just because the bread is flat and it makes it easier to soak the bread in the custard. If you're dealing with a flat bowl instead of the mixing bowl that you had a minute ago, it will go better. All right! Right into the frying pan. These are like sponges. Squeeze it a little. Here's the secret pro-tip: sprinkle with sugar as they're almost done and flip.  You'll get a nice brown with that sugar.  It will give you a little bit of a caramelly crust.  Go in with the granulated sugar again. We're mere seconds from done here. Nice. Nice. Just want to caramelize that sugar I sprinkled on. of bread til it's just nice and flat take each rolled out piece of bread and spread it with that beautiful Nutella chocolate hazelnut spread and gently roll it up to make a nice little roll then continue on with the rest next I'm going to make a little bit of cinnamon sugar all I'm going to do is combine two tablespoons of white sugar with about a teaspoon heaped teaspoon of ground cinnamon and just mix those together and set that cinnamon sugar aside for the moment in another little bowl I've got one egg and I'm just going to add in a small splash of milk probably about a tablespoon or so and using a fork we're just going to beat the egg and milk together until we get a nice runny mixture and we are just about ready to start making our french toast rolls we're all set up ready to fry these up I've got my fry pan over a medium heat and I've just got a little bit of butter probably about 20 grams roughly and yes I am frying these in butter but let's face facts we're not making a salad here we're making something rather naughty I don't know recommend having this up on a regular basis but it's good nonetheless once that butter is melted and bubbling we're going to dip each one in turn these little french toast rolls into the egg mixture shake off any excess and place it straight into the pan and just keep going with the rest get them all nice and coated in the egg mixture to let them soak or anything just get them nice and coated and add these to cook for about a minute per side or until they're nice and golden all over last but not least we're just going to roll each of the french toast rolls in the cinnamon sugar nice encoded and here we have our completed nutella french toast rolls looking absolutely gorgeous I cannot wait to give these a try these are just absolutely stunning I cannot wait to dive into this I probably should use a knife and fork but having heatproof fingers and no patience mmm mmm and an explosion a beautiful warm chocolatey Nutella just burst in your mouth mmm it's beautiful and golden and slightly crisp you've got that lovely cinnamon sugar on the outside and all over my fingers YUM ridiculously decadent definitely want to try at least once in a lifetime well I hope you enjoyed this recipe check out my other videos at one-pot chef show calm and until next time see you later big thanks to my good friend and fellow youtuber miss Burpee who introduced me to this recipe and I'm sending you the heart attack bill hmm

title: Make French Toast
content: Food Recipe French Toast Recipe Check Out The Ingredients 6 thick slices bread 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg (optional) 2 eggs 1 teaspoon vanilla extract (optional) 2/3 cup milk salt to taste 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon (optional) Prep 5 m | Cook 15 m | Ready In 20 m Beat together egg, milk, salt, desired spices and vanilla. Heat a lightly oiled griddle or skillet over medium-high heat. Dunk each slice of bread in egg mixture, soaking both sides. Place in pan, and cook on both sides until golden. Serve hot. Serve hot If you like Our Video  then Please LIke Share and Comment

transcript.text: Food Recipe
French Toast Recipe
Check Out The Ingredients
6 thick slices bread
1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg (optional)
2 eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla extract (optional)
2/3 cup milk
salt to taste
1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon (optional)
Prep 5 m | Cook 15 m | Ready In 20 m
Beat together egg, milk, salt, desired spices and vanilla.
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or skillet over medium-high heat.
Dunk each slice of bread in egg mixture, soaking both sides.
Place in pan, and cook on both sides until golden. Serve hot.
Serve hot
If you like Our Video  then Please LIke Share and Comment

title: Make French Toast
content:
Stephanie Manley: Hi! This is Stephanie Manley and you know me from
Copykat.com. But today I'm working my way through my old
Home Economics book from junior high school to where I can teach you how to cook just
how I was taught how to cook. And today we're making French Toast, and it's
very very easy to make. And everyone, or practically everyone has
some left over bread and an egg and some milk. And guess what! That's all you need to make a nice breakfast,
or lunch, doesn't matter. Okay, so I'm using a griddle here. Now, if you don't have one you can use a skillet,
that's going to work just as well. But I'm using my griddle, because I love being
able to make so many pieces at once. This is really really easy to do, you need
a few ingredients, not too many. You need bread, we're going to use a quarter
cup of milk. Now, ideally you should try to measure liquid
ingredients in a liquid measuring cup because they're more accurate this way. If you don't have one, that's okay, but if
you do, grab that one. We're going to use one egg. Now, I'm using a large egg, if you only have
small eggs, you might want to use a couple, but just one egg. We need just a little bit of salt because
that helps everything taste a little bit better. We're going to use sugar because this recipe
was developed a long time ago when we used to stick sugar in everything. No, actually sugar is pretty good in here. And, just a sprinkle of cinnamon if you like,
that's going to add some great flavor. So, let me tell you what we're going to do. We're simply going to take our egg, we're
going to crack it in our bowl and we're just going to beat it up. Then, we're going to add in our milk and we're
going to continue to beat this all together. And you want to beat it until it's all nice
and creamy and yellow. And at this point, we're going to add one
tablespoon of sugar, this makes it taste really good. And we're going to add just a little bit of
salt. If you have a measuring thing, you might want
to use about a quarter of teaspoon of salt, you don't need hardly any at all. And then we need just a sprinkle of cinnamon. And if you want to measure it, about a quarter
of a teaspoon of cinnamon should be plenty. All right, and we're just going to continue
to whisk this in here together. Now, before I cook anything on the griddle,
I'm just going to put down a little bit of butter. If you have non-stick spray, that'll also
work. And we're just going to put our butter on
the griddle, so our bread won't stick. Then all you need to do is take your bread
and dip it in, then dip it in, you don't need for it to soak in or anything like that. And you're just going to put it on the griddle,
just like that. Okay, and you're just going to let these cook
for about two, two and a half minutes on each side, they'll get nice and golden brown. Now, if it's cooking faster than that, turn
down your heat because it's up too high. If you're using just a regular electric stove
or a gas stove, I would put it on between low and medium, so it doesn't cook too fast,
nobody likes burnt French toast. So after about another minute or so, we're
going to flip these over and let them cook on the other side. So we flipped over our French toast and it's
cooked now on the second side for a couple of minutes. And now I'm just going to go ahead and take
these off. And here you go, you have a great big stack
of French toast, and wasn't that easy to make! So please give this video a big thumbs up. And if you're learning how to cook, maybe
a comment down below and tell me what you'd like to cook and I will help you learn how
to cook that recipe. Thanks for watching!

If you're using just a regular electric stove
or a gas stove, I would put it on between

low and medium, so it doesn't cook too fast,
nobody likes burnt French toast.

So after about another minute or so, we're
going to flip these over and let them cook
on the other side.

So we flipped over our French toast and it's
cooked now on the second side for a couple
of minutes.

And now I'm just going to go ahead and take
these off.

And here you go, you have a great big stack
of French toast, and wasn't that easy to make!
So please give this video a big thumbs up.

And if you're learning how to cook, maybe
a comment down below and tell me what you'd

like to cook and I will help you learn how
to cook that recipe.
Thanks for watching!

title: Make French Toast
content: to make these delicious french toast roll-ups you're going to need some eggs some fresh strawberries some chip chocolate peanut butter some white bread and some cinnamon sugar so the first thing you're going to do is take a few of your fresh strawberries and slice them up very thin because if you don't do it since then the bread is going to fall apart Nia then you're just going to crack three eggs into a bowl design it out a little bit I took a half of a shot glass and filled it with water and poured it in and then I just whisked it all together then you just take some bread however much you want to do and start cutting off the crusts of it into a perfect square then you take the jib chocolate peanut butter and start spreading Matt a little bit over each piece then you just start adding a couple pieces of the strawberries don't have too many or the bread will fall apart when you try to roll it up very gently and carefully start trying to roll up the piece of bread and if it starts falling apart you can just kind of pinch it back together then just get an empty plate and sprinkle cinnamon sugar all over it carefully roll the bread and the egg yolk and then move it to the cinnamon sugar and rollin put the stove on medium carefully place on in the frying pan and let them cook for just a couple minutes when they're done you can just take them out of the pan and put them on a plate for them to cool and then if you choose you can add just a little bit of whipped cream on top so here's the finished product I hope you guys enjoyed watching this video if you'd like to see more cooking videos from me then like this video and please subscribe to my channel

title: Make French Toast
content: allrecipes member elisa w submits this stellar recipe for stuffed french toast saying it's a nice change from ordinary french toast although this is my family's favorite version it's very versatile to begin we have 4 ounces of softened cream cheese we're going to spread this on to four slices of oat nut bread thick cut french bread and mascarpone cheese would be an excellent option here too now spread a half cup of seedless raspberry jam on 24 more slices of oat nut bread you could use fresh fruit in addition to the jam we're adding a half cup of fresh raspberries press the cream cheese and jam slices together forming sandwiches in a medium shallow bowl be together five eggs this recipe calls for a quarter cup of milk and one-and-a-half teaspoons of almond extract we're using vanilla soy milk and vanilla extract instead for extra flavor in a large heavy skillet melt 1 tablespoon of butter over medium-high heat dip the sandwiches into the egg batter and coat completely place on the heated skillet and cook until golden brown 2 to 4 minutes per side cooking batches adding more butter if necessary allrecipes member a little buff 76 says this stuff french toast recipe was a big hit using french bread blackberry jam and topping it off with powdered sugar yummy

cooking batches adding more butter if
necessary

hit using french bread blackberry jam

yummy

title: Make French Toast
content:
Mmm. Who doesn’t like a nice big plate of
French toast? Nice firm bread soaked in eggs with milk, maybe garnished with a little bit
of fresh fruit, some cinnamon and slathered over the top with maple syrup. Have you ever
wondered where this dish came from? What genius mind created it and who throughout history
savored this delectable dish? Well that’s what we’re going to look at today in 18th
Century Cooking with Jas. Townsend and Son. We’re wrapping up our second series of 18th
Century Cooking with Jas. Townsend and Son. Most recently we’ve been looking at 18th
century breads and we thought it would be appropriate to conclude this series with a
little sweet treat made with bread. The earliest recipe for French toast can be
found in the Apicius. It’s a 4th and 5th century collection of Roman recipes. The dish
is simply titled A Sweet Treat and the translation reads thus, “Break a slice of fine white
bread, crust removed, into rather large pieces, soak in milk and beat in eggs, fry in oil,
cover in honey, and serve.” Bread was known as a staff of life. It was
a dietary pillar, but what does one do when one’s bread goes stale? In an old English
cookbook from about 1430, we find a recipe for bread that’s sliced, dipped in eggs,
fried in butter and then sprinkled with a little bit of sugar. The name of this recipe
was Payn perdu, a French word that means lost bread or wasted bread, suggesting that this
recipe was meant to use up stale bread. Karen Hess who transcribed Martha Washington’s
Booke of Cookery has this to say in a recipe after Payn Perdu. It says, “The English
early took to Payn Perdu and made it their own. It was rarely omitted from a cookbook,
usually listed under made dishes. Made dishes are any dish that amuses the cook or shows
off her skill.” Let’s make French toast or Payn Perdu in
a true 18th century fashion. We’re going to start off with a nice enriched
bread. The no knead French bread like we made in our last episode would be perfect. If you
want to use a more modern bread, you can use a challah bread or a brioche, any firm bread
will do. We’ve cut the crust off this and we’ve
let it set out overnight, so we’re starting off with a nice stale bread. I’m going to
start off here with about 8 egg yolks and to that I’m going to add about a cup of
cream and I’m also going to add some wine, some sac here. We’re going to use about
a quarter of a cup. Now I’m going to add about two tablespoons of sugar and finally
I’m going to scrape in a little bit of nutmeg and we’ll whisk this all together. Now let’s take our individual bread pieces
and put them in the batter. I’m going to let these set for maybe 15
minutes or up to an hour to get this a real good chance to soak in. It really depends
on how stale your bread is. While these toasts are steeping, I’m going to go ahead and
start on our sauce, because we want to have the sauce ready to put on it as soon as they’re
cooked. We’re going to start off with about four
tablespoons of butter and then once that’s melted, let’s add in about two tablespoons
of sac, and after the sac we’re going to add about a tablespoon of sugar. Now you want to whisk this all together, then
you want it to get nice and warm, but we’re really not cooking it, we’re just really
mixing it together, so what I’m going to do is set this aside where it’ll stay nice
and warm waiting for us to put it on. I’ve got the butter going in the pan, let’s
put in our toasts. If your bread’s really stale, sometimes it can be very fragile so you might have to be careful as you put it in the pan. These look done. Let’s get them out of here. Here’s our Payn Perdu, an early version
of French toast. Let’s give it a try. Mmm. That is excellent. This topping’s a
little different from what you and I might expect or what we’re used to. Very nice.
Right out of the 18th century cookbooks. Maple syrup as a topping is a perfect North American
variation on that same theme. They’re substitute for sugar, maple syrup. Excellent.
We hope you’ve enjoyed this episode of 18th Century Cooking with Jas. Townsend and Son.
Be sure to watch for more episodes in the near future. Also, make sure to check out
our new cooking blog SavoringThePast.net for today’s recipe as well as other documentation
and discoveries in 18th century cooking. All the clothing you’ve seen here today
and all the cooking accessories, all these things are available in our print catalog
or on our website. I want to invite you to subscribe to our YouTube channel and follow
us on Facebook and I want to thank you for joining us as we savor the flavors and the
aromas of the 18th century. Here’s our Payn Perdu an early version of
French toast. Let’s give it a try. That is excellent. You know, It is, it’s
really… {Beep} Mmm. That is excellent. Tha… the… the….
Gosh… {Beep} So that’s why you see maple syrup in so
many different… mmmm… that was stupid…{Beep} Ahh, that is, that is super {Beep} This would be used as a dessert, not as a
brexst, breakfast… {Beep} Mmm, that is excellent. This topping’s a
little bit different than what you and I mi(cough)… Here I get it stuck in my throat and I can’t
talk. {Beep} Have you ever wondered where this comes from?
I have. (Laughing)

title: Make French Toast
content: spring is here and it is time to get our brunch on today we're going to be making french toast roll-ups with apples strawberries and bananas let's go ahead and get cooking the first step to your new go to brunch obsession is to take your knife and cut all of the crusts off the bread the next step is use your rolling pin to roll out your bread until it's really thick I absolutely love to use a nonstick rolling pin when I'm working with bread and now for the yummy puck get to add your favorite filling so I'm using three of my favorite banana Nutella strawberry cream cheese apple and peanut butter next roll up each one of your bread so it's nice and secure next step is to take your eggs crack them and we are going to make an egg wash cinnamon sugar nutmeg and a few dashes of vanilla next step is to put your egg wash in a flat container I like using a pie pan is it super easy we're going to take each one of our roll-ups and we're going to roll it in our Meg next step is to pour your cinnamon sugar in a flat plate and roll each one of your egg wash roll up spin it to completely coat it in cinnamon sugar while you're rolling your roll-ups in your cinnamon sugar have your butter melting in your pan so you're ready for the next step you're ready to put your roll-ups in the pan you're going to let them cook for about 5 to 6 minutes rotating them every 30 to 45 seconds until they're golden brown once they're fully brown you want to remove them from the heat and top them with your favorite toppings like whipped cream caramel and even powdered sugar I don't know about you guys but I'm definitely ready to do brunch make sure to share your favorite brunch recipes with us in the comments alright guys we'll see you next time hmm so good [Music]

title: Make French Toast
content: today we are going to make bass and bread toast or eggless french toast ingredients our bread slices chickpea flour or besan dodge van or carom seeds garlic paste baking powder salt red chilli powder oil for frying and water for making the batter first to the basin at the edge wine the salt baking powder red chili powder garlic paste and add water little at a time to make the batter the consistency of the batter has to be slightly less than what is done for the dosa batter slightly thinner mix it well and see that there are no lumps break all lumps add water slowly and little each time so that the batter does not get too thin if it is thick you can add more water later on if you prefer spicy then you're going to add chopped green chilies the batter is just about ready now neither do thin not too thick so that coats the bread pieces well you'd require quantity of oil for deep-frying and on a plate spray some paper towels or tissues to soak thee you can check if the oil is hot or not by dropping a little batter in the hot oil and if the batter comes to top and starts floating the oil is hot and now dunk a bread slice in the batter coated thoroughly on both sides and then drop it in the hot oil carefully and then fry the bread slice on both the sides till it's golden brown d fry to the verse slices golden brown on both the sides the basin is cooked properly is not raw and then done transfer this slice or the basin toast to the plate with the paper towels on top similarly one by one fry all the bread slices you got each Basin toes diagonally across to make two triangles and you can serve this with Amato sauce green chutney which is a combination of mint and coriander or Dania hope you liked the video do try making it thank you and have a nice day

title: Make French Toast
content:
Hi, I’m Chef Tony Matassa. Today we are preparing an epic french toast
breakfast sandwich on our Lynx Asado Griddle. Now for the french toast, I like to pick up
a couple loaves of country white bread, and make thick slices of toast, about 2 inches
thick. I place the slices in the oven at 300 degrees
for a few minutes so that they can crisp up a bit. For the french toast batter, start by combining
corn starch with some confectioners sugar and sift it into a mixing bowl. Here I have 6 egg yolks and 4 whole eggs,
give this a good whisk and add in a couple teaspoons of vanilla extract. Once combined, pour this mixture into a mixing
bowl, and whisk the ingredients to combine. Now to sweeten up the batter, I like to use
honey because it gives nice flavor to the french toast, and helps to emulsify the batter. Finish this off with some melted butter that
has cooled, followed by some half and half. It's time to give the slices of toast a dunk
in the batter, make sure to coat both sides well, you'll be glad you did! Go ahead and heat up your griddle to medium-
high heat and throw some butter on there, because butter and french toast is always
a great combo! After a minute or two, the first side should
have some good color on it, you can go ahead and flip to the other side. These are looking great, I'll go ahead and
remove them to a pan and grill up the rest of the sandwich ingredients… and where would
this french toast sandwich be without some thick cut bacon? No worries, there will be some eggs and cheese
too, but I like to get a good coating of bacon fat on the griddle before the eggs. I always love cooking up bacon on a griddle
like this, because I just can't fit all the bacon I want in one pan! Once the bacon is good and crispy, it's time
to scramble some eggs for this sandwich. Luckily eggs cook quick, because I am pretty
ready to dive into this french toast sandwich! It's time to build this monster! Start out by setting down a slice of french
toast.. followed by some scrambled eggs.. a slice of colby jack cheese.. now for the
bacon, nothing says breakfast like the combination of syrup and bacon.. but why stop there? Why not infuse bacon into the syrup itself?? This is really easy to make, I cooked down
a half lb. Of bacon, chop it into bits, and heated up
a cup of maple syrup with the bacon bits for a few minutes, then just cool and let it infuse
overnight. After a drizzle of bacon syrup, go ahead and
add the top layer of french toast.. and you'll want to and top the whole thing with bacon
syrup, because.. why not? Oh, and don't forget the final garnish of
butter and powdered sugar! Now I could stare at this all day, but I'm
pretty hungry so let's dig in! Phenomenal flavor combo.. bacon.. french toast..
bacon maple syrup.. forget about it! Thank you for watching, I hope you enjoyed
it and I hope if you have any questions on the Lynx Asado grill, you’ll give us a call
or check us out online today. I’m Chef Tony Matassa, and remember.. at
BBQGuys.com, we SMOKE the competition!

breakfast sandwich on our Lynx Asado Griddle.

high heat and throw some butter on there,

because butter and french toast is always

thick cut bacon?

fat on the griddle before the eggs.

Once the bacon is good and crispy, it's time

Start out by setting down a slice of french

a slice of colby jack cheese.. now for the

want to and top the whole thing with bacon

Oh, and don't forget the final garnish of
butter and powdered sugar!

Now I could stare at this all day, but I'm
pretty hungry so let's dig in!

Phenomenal flavor combo.. bacon.. french toast..
bacon maple syrup.. forget about it!

Thank you for watching, I hope you enjoyed
it and I hope if you have any questions on

the Lynx Asado grill, you’ll give us a call
or check us out online today.

I’m Chef Tony Matassa, and remember.. at
BBQGuys.com, we SMOKE the competition!

title: Make French Toast
content:
Does your family crave French toast? If so, they'll love this rich and creamy stuffed
French toast. You prep at the night before and slip them
on to the griddle the next morning, perfect for a weekend brunch or holiday breakfast. Let's make the filling first. Place half of an 8-ounce package of soft and
cream cheese in a medium bowl, add 2 tablespoons of sugar, and 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla. Then beat the filling until it's smooth. Next, cut four 1-1/2-inch thick slices of
Challah, Italian or French bread. Use day old bread if you have it as it'll
soak up an optimal amount of custard for the best French toast. Cut a pocket in each bread slice. And then fill the pocket with the cream cheese
mixture. Arrange the slices in a 3/4 rectangular baking
dish. Set it aside. Crack 4 eggs into a medium bowl. Then add 1 cup of milk, 2 tablespoons of honey
or sugar, and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract. Whisk this until it's well-blended. Now pour the mixture over the bread slices
covering the tops of the bread. Cover the baking dish and chill for 2 to 24
hours. You'll want to turn the bread slices once
or twice during the chilling time. Just before serving, please set griddle over
medium heat and grease it lightly. Cook the bread slices until they're golden
brown. It takes about 2 to 3 minutes for each side. Flip them and cook the other side. For a finishing touch, dust the stuffed French
toast with a little confectionary sugar and serve it with maple syrup.

transcript.text: Does your family crave French toast?

If so, they'll love this rich and creamy stuffed
French toast.

You prep at the night before and slip them
on to the griddle the next morning, perfect
for a weekend brunch or holiday breakfast.
Let's make the filling first.

Place half of an 8-ounce package of soft and
cream cheese in a medium bowl, add 2 tablespoons
of sugar, and 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla.
Then beat the filling until it's smooth.

Next, cut four 1-1/2-inch thick slices of
Challah, Italian or French bread.

Use day old bread if you have it as it'll
soak up an optimal amount of custard for the
best French toast.
Cut a pocket in each bread slice.

And then fill the pocket with the cream cheese
mixture.

Arrange the slices in a 3/4 rectangular baking
dish.
Set it aside.
Crack 4 eggs into a medium bowl.

Then add 1 cup of milk, 2 tablespoons of honey
or sugar, and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract.
Whisk this until it's well-blended.

Now pour the mixture over the bread slices
covering the tops of the bread.

Cover the baking dish and chill for 2 to 24
hours.

You'll want to turn the bread slices once
or twice during the chilling time.

Just before serving, please set griddle over
medium heat and grease it lightly.

Cook the bread slices until they're golden
brown.
It takes about 2 to 3 minutes for each side.
Flip them and cook the other side.

For a finishing touch, dust the stuffed French
toast with a little confectionary sugar and
serve it with maple syrup.

title: Make French Toast
content: hi welcome to hot chocolate heads I'm medica and today I'm going to show you how to make french toast doughnuts these are not doughnuts that are made into french toast it's our french toast that tastes like doughnuts because ever so often you get this strong craving for like a good sugar doughnut and often times okay like especially like at midnight when you get those cravings you can't go out and buy doughnuts because you won't get the best ones so today I'm going to show you how to make a super simple version to satisfy that craving this recipe is actually nigella lawson's recipes I'm really excited about making it because it's so so good so let's get started so you want to start by slicing two slices of bread in half you can do this either horizontally or vertically or diagonally have four you'd like now this serves one person so you only need two slices of bread but if you double the recipe you can serve two people so once you've sliced your bread into four halves you're going to take a shallow dish and into that dish you're going to crack one whole egg and my yolk was surprisingly orange which is kind of strange but you know that's what you get and you're going to add one tablespoon of whole milk or half milk or whatever kind of milk you like could also use heavy cream and of course you're going to add in 2 teaspoons of vanilla extract and this really gives the french toast that doughnut flavor that you want and then you just want to beat all these ingredients together until they are slightly frothy and well combined then in the skillet or a saucepan you're going to melt about half a tablespoon of butter you can use salted or unsalted I like to use salted just because it adds a nice hint of salt to the french toast and then you're going to dip the halves of the bread into the egg mixture you can do this using your fingers or you can use a fork and just make sure that that bread really absorbs the egg mixture you just want to make sure that the bread kind doesn't disintegrate in the egg mixture because then it's going to be nearly impossible to transfer which you're going to do right now so just transfer the house to the pan with the melted butter and cook and I like to do this about two at a time just because my skin this small but if you have a bigger one you can do more at a time just cook them for about 30 seconds on each side and then flip them over and what you're looking for is that beautiful golden color that you know and love in a french toast but that you also know and love in a donut and now for the best part you're going to transfer the halves of the french toast one at a time into a shallow dish or plate covered in powdered sugar you can also use superfine or caster sugar but I feel like if you use granulated sugar which was the only kind of sugar I head aside from powdered sugar you'll get that gritty flavor and I don't like a gritty flavor when I you don't answer when I eat french toast so I think that powdered sugar actually replicates a sugar donut really really well just the only thing is that powder trigger has a tendency to melt really quickly so you might have to double dip it or you might have to eat it right immediately after you've dipped it I know essentially you have donuts plain but I love to serve these with some fresh strawberries or fruit and enjoy them for breakfast so you can serve these any way you want to with some chocolate syrup with some maple syrup although I don't know why you'd add more sugar because it's already showed up I just like to serve them with some fresh strawberries so now I'm going to give them a taste that certainly satisfies my doughnut craving I must say so it does taste like it's kind of in the middle of a french toast and a donut it has lots of vanilla extract and I believe that it's the vanilla extract that really makes it taste like a doughnut but you don't have to wait for all that time to let the dough rise you can just make these like instantly they take five minutes to make and they're so delicious I really hope you give this a try and guess what it's almost donut day national donut day or whatever so if you are interested in making a really cool-looking donut you can check out some videos from other tastemade members they show you how to make some awesome doughnuts so I hope you check those out too but if you want an instant version make this don't forget to rate comment and subscribe and I will see you next time goodbye
