title: Make French Toast
content: hey guys it's Joanne from fifteen spatulas and today we're going to make Bananas Foster french toast I totally understand why people want to go out for brunch because then you don't have to cook but I really love making myself brunch on the weekends because then you don't have to put your real clothes on you just cook in your pajamas you can eat your yummy brunch food or like cozy and cuddle up on the couch and this Bananas Foster french toast is so delicious it is one of my favorite things to make for brunch it's bananas cooked and a spiced rum butter brown sugar nutmeg cinnamon sauce and it's topped on a classic challah french toast it's kind of dessert for breakfast but that's what brunch is half the time and this one's definitely worth it let me show you how to make it heat a skillet over medium heat and add a quarter cup or a half stick of butter move this all around with a spatula to let it melt down then add a quarter cup of brown sugar light or dark brown sugar is fine 1/2 teaspoon of ground cinnamon and about 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg I love to grate mine fresh but you can use pre-ground mix this all together to combine the ingredients into a sauce while the butter is still melting peel two large bananas and then cut them into thirds and cut each piece in half through the middle place the sliced bananas into the sauce I like to do it cut side down first and then bring the sauce to a bubble and cook the bananas in the sauce for 2 minutes until soft and then flip them all over with a spatula let them cook for 2 minutes on the other side the sauce around the bananas will get thick and sticky take the skillet completely off the stove so you don't let your hand on fire and add a quarter cup of dark spiced rum then bring the skillet back to the flame gently tilt the pan until the sauce catches that flame you get a nice beautiful flambe let the alcohol flame and cook off which should take about 10 to 15 seconds and then you can turn off the heat the sauce should be very sticky thick and bubbly at this point and the banana should be a deep golden color to make the French toast I'm using challah which is a very eggy bread it's my absolute favorite for French toast slice it into thick pieces about an inch each and you can see how fluffy and squishy the challah is it's also fairly dense which is why it's so perfect for French toast crack two large eggs and a flat dish and add 3/4 of a cup of half-and-half you can get away with milk if that's what you have and then I add 1/2 teaspoon of ground cinnamon we whisk this all together until ingredients are well blended then place the sliced challah into the egg mixture let it sit for a minute or two and then flip each one over for another two minutes to let the other side soak heat a nonstick skillet over a medium heat and melt 1 tablespoon of butter and then add the soaked challah as many as will fit without overcrowding the pan and let cook for 2 to 3 minutes until the bottom is golden brown and then flip each piece over with a Turner it's so golden and lovely and then cook for 2 to 3 minutes on the other side to make sure the egg is cooked through add a couple slices of french toast to a plate and then serve with the bananas and sauce mooned over as your syrup you can dust this with powdered sugar if you'd like and it's ready to enjoy oh my goodness it's time to dig in get some of that sauce on there some of that banana Hey this show would I don't know if you guys have ever had Bananas Foster before but I remember in the past I'd always think that there's so much extra sauce you feel ridiculous eating that sauce by this beautiful but you don't want to waste it but that's why I Bananas Foster french toast is so great because that Bananas Foster sauce takes the place of maple syrup or other types of syrup that we would use like these two things were totally meant for each other well I hope you guys enjoyed learning how to make this recipe and if you did and you want to see more brunch recipes in the future let me know with a thumbs up make sure you subscribe so you don't miss out in any future recipe videos thanks for watching and I'll see you guys next time

Hey Cookaholics Chef Kendra Here and today

Orange Rolls. So make sure you all go check Rosie's channel. I'll toss up the link at the end of this video
and it'll also be in the ABOUT SECTION below. I'm offering up some stuffed French toast. So, let's do what we do, head into the kitchen
and make this happen. OK, we have our stuff waiting for us. I'm slicing some brioche into some nice thick
pieces. If you can't find brioche just use some quality
French bread. However brioche is much better for this dish. This is fresh baked. I'm using a small knife to cut straight down
into the bread on the top and I'm going to do the same thing on the bottom creating a
nice place for our filling to live. Just like so. Speaking of filling we're sliding some cream
cheese into our bowl and we're going to add some powdered sugar and some vanilla. We're going to roughly mix this together with
a folk, then use our electric mixer to finish the job because we don't want a powdered sugar

in this bowl for our French bread batter. We have a towel under our bowl for stability. Now we're going to get a pan under medium
low heat. Add a little butter and some oil. This is similar to a grill cheese as in you

into our French toast batter and make magic. If you like a really soaked piece of French

video on how to make homemade whipped cream you can click the links to look at those. Make sure you check out Rosie's Channel, I
heart recipes. Share my videos and if you haven't already,
Subscribe. Chef Kendra is out. Peace.

title: Make French Toast
content: I okay come on you guys time to go get ready hey guys it's lethal now I'm the mother of two kids and if your house is anything like mine in the morning you're familiar with the challenge of the morning crunch there's hair - style clothes - get on backpacks - pack and on top of it all we want to send our kids off with a healthy breakfast now if my kids could eat something sweet every day they would and french toast is their favorite however I really don't want them to get too much sugar in the morning which is why I now make a lighter version of my french toast it was a really easy switch to make and now my kids can eat what they love and I can feel super confident about sending them off in the morning with a good breakfast so here's how you make this french toast it's really quick and simple in a bowl you're going to combine some skim milk a little bit of egg product some salt and a little bit of vanilla next you're going to add in your true via natural sweetener Truvia is a zero calorie natural sweetener whose sweetness comes from the leaves of the stevia plan so it's a great alternative to sugar it's sweet it's simple it's easy to use in baking and all sorts of other recipes so we're going to whisk all those ingredients together and pour them into a shallow baking dish that's easy to dip our bread in now we're going to go ahead and heat up our griddle once it's nice and warm I'm gonna rub it with a little butter that'll give it a little extra flavor and a nice golden brown color for this recipe I like to use flourless sprouted 100% whole grain bread this is a great alternative to your regular white bread it's packed with nutrients and whole grains it's really really good for you we're going to take our bread and dip it in our egg mixture make sure each side gets a good coating and put it on our hot griddle cook it three to four minutes give it a flip and cook it a couple more minutes you're looking for a nice golden brown color when it's all done I like to drizzle it with a little bit of syrup and a bunch of fresh berries my kids love berries so I have strawberries raspberries blueberries and blackberries but you can use whatever fruit you want I love that my kids are getting fresh fruit in the morning such an important part of good nutrition believe me in our crazy morning my kids are happy to sit down to a big plate of french toast fresh berries a glass of milk gives us a really healthy start to our day we've got calcium whole grains fresh fruit so I'm telling you if you're looking for some recipes that your kids will love but as a mom you're trying to tone down the sugar give this french toast to try it's a lighter version of a classic breakfast that your family will love it's a delicious way to start off any day and we'll have everybody happy as they walk out the door you

indicator light has changed to red. Then serve with additional maple syrup on the side.

title: Make French Toast
content:
Hi, I’m Chef Tony Matassa. Today we are preparing an epic french toast
breakfast sandwich on our Lynx Asado Griddle. Now for the french toast, I like to pick up
a couple loaves of country white bread, and make thick slices of toast, about 2 inches
thick. I place the slices in the oven at 300 degrees
for a few minutes so that they can crisp up a bit. For the french toast batter, start by combining
corn starch with some confectioners sugar and sift it into a mixing bowl. Here I have 6 egg yolks and 4 whole eggs,
give this a good whisk and add in a couple teaspoons of vanilla extract. Once combined, pour this mixture into a mixing
bowl, and whisk the ingredients to combine. Now to sweeten up the batter, I like to use
honey because it gives nice flavor to the french toast, and helps to emulsify the batter. Finish this off with some melted butter that
has cooled, followed by some half and half. It's time to give the slices of toast a dunk
in the batter, make sure to coat both sides well, you'll be glad you did! Go ahead and heat up your griddle to medium-
high heat and throw some butter on there, because butter and french toast is always
a great combo! After a minute or two, the first side should
have some good color on it, you can go ahead and flip to the other side. These are looking great, I'll go ahead and
remove them to a pan and grill up the rest of the sandwich ingredients… and where would
this french toast sandwich be without some thick cut bacon? No worries, there will be some eggs and cheese
too, but I like to get a good coating of bacon fat on the griddle before the eggs. I always love cooking up bacon on a griddle
like this, because I just can't fit all the bacon I want in one pan! Once the bacon is good and crispy, it's time
to scramble some eggs for this sandwich. Luckily eggs cook quick, because I am pretty
ready to dive into this french toast sandwich! It's time to build this monster! Start out by setting down a slice of french
toast.. followed by some scrambled eggs.. a slice of colby jack cheese.. now for the
bacon, nothing says breakfast like the combination of syrup and bacon.. but why stop there? Why not infuse bacon into the syrup itself?? This is really easy to make, I cooked down
a half lb. Of bacon, chop it into bits, and heated up
a cup of maple syrup with the bacon bits for a few minutes, then just cool and let it infuse
overnight. After a drizzle of bacon syrup, go ahead and
add the top layer of french toast.. and you'll want to and top the whole thing with bacon
syrup, because.. why not? Oh, and don't forget the final garnish of
butter and powdered sugar! Now I could stare at this all day, but I'm
pretty hungry so let's dig in! Phenomenal flavor combo.. bacon.. french toast..
bacon maple syrup.. forget about it! Thank you for watching, I hope you enjoyed
it and I hope if you have any questions on the Lynx Asado grill, you’ll give us a call
or check us out online today. I’m Chef Tony Matassa, and remember.. at
BBQGuys.com, we SMOKE the competition!

transcript.text: Hi, I’m Chef Tony Matassa.

Today we are preparing an epic french toast
breakfast sandwich on our Lynx Asado Griddle.

Now for the french toast, I like to pick up
a couple loaves of country white bread, and

make thick slices of toast, about 2 inches
thick.

I place the slices in the oven at 300 degrees
for a few minutes so that they can crisp up
a bit.

For the french toast batter, start by combining
corn starch with some confectioners sugar
and sift it into a mixing bowl.

Here I have 6 egg yolks and 4 whole eggs,
give this a good whisk and add in a couple
teaspoons of vanilla extract.

Once combined, pour this mixture into a mixing
bowl, and whisk the ingredients to combine.

Now to sweeten up the batter, I like to use
honey because it gives nice flavor to the
french toast, and helps to emulsify the batter.

Finish this off with some melted butter that
has cooled, followed by some half and half.

It's time to give the slices of toast a dunk
in the batter, make sure to coat both sides
well, you'll be glad you did!

Go ahead and heat up your griddle to medium-
high heat and throw some butter on there,

because butter and french toast is always
a great combo!

After a minute or two, the first side should
have some good color on it, you can go ahead
and flip to the other side.

These are looking great, I'll go ahead and
remove them to a pan and grill up the rest

of the sandwich ingredients… and where would
this french toast sandwich be without some
thick cut bacon?

No worries, there will be some eggs and cheese
too, but I like to get a good coating of bacon
fat on the griddle before the eggs.

I always love cooking up bacon on a griddle
like this, because I just can't fit all the
bacon I want in one pan!

Once the bacon is good and crispy, it's time
to scramble some eggs for this sandwich.

Luckily eggs cook quick, because I am pretty
ready to dive into this french toast sandwich!
It's time to build this monster!

Start out by setting down a slice of french
toast.. followed by some scrambled eggs..

a slice of colby jack cheese.. now for the
bacon, nothing says breakfast like the combination
of syrup and bacon.. but why stop there?
Why not infuse bacon into the syrup itself??

This is really easy to make, I cooked down
a half lb.

Of bacon, chop it into bits, and heated up
a cup of maple syrup with the bacon bits for

Oh, and don't forget the final garnish of
butter and powdered sugar!

Now I could stare at this all day, but I'm

Phenomenal flavor combo.. bacon.. french toast..
bacon maple syrup.. forget about it!

Thank you for watching, I hope you enjoyed
it and I hope if you have any questions on

the Lynx Asado grill, you’ll give us a call
or check us out online today.

I’m Chef Tony Matassa, and remember.. at

title: Make French Toast
content: during the week our mornings are just one big rush I have to get my kids out of the house by seven fifteen so breakfast is usually a quick bowl of cereal a granola bar maybe an apple on the way out the door and that's about it so when saturday mornings come that's like our time that's our family time to sleep in and snuggle and ma join in our pajamas and make a big family breakfast all together and for us that go to saturday morning breakfast is french toast french toast is not complicated there's you know everybody has their own way to make it it's bread soaked in egg and grilled on a griddle I like to use a really healthy 12 grain bread the nuts and the seeds give it some good texture and and it's good for them but they don't really know the difference the egg mixture is just one egg yolk and the rest egg whites the kids don't notice the difference at all and it tastes just as good in the end add my cinnamon in there I pour the vanilla in a little dash of nutmeg you take the bread and you soak it in the egg mixture you want to really leave it for like you know 30 45 seconds on each side you want to make sure it's soaked it if you just quickly put the bread in it kind of sits on top but it doesn't really soak in there you're gonna put the bread down on the griddle for like you know a minute or so on each side you want to make sure it's really browned and golden looking then I like to take it and put it in the oven while the french kiss is warming in the oven that's when I make the whipped cream so I just use some heavy whipping cream i put my vanilla in there a little dash of sugar take the french toast out of the oven I sliced up my fresh bananas pour the sweet stir up all over the top with the whipped cream on top my kids feel like they're eating something super delicious and like a big treat like the joke's on you mom we're going to eat dessert for breakfast it's just a meal that we can all sit around and enjoy together in our pajamas on Saturday morning it's just like warm cozy family time and it's what I cherish most I look forward to it all week you

pretty thick and it will be using that for this recipe along with that you will need some whole milk heavy whipping cream sugar unsalted butter eggs vanilla extract and some cinnamon for your optional ingredients you can either use some syrup or some confectioner sugar and there you have it add two eggs half a cup of whole milk 1/2 a cup of heavy whipping cream 1/4 cup of sugar and 2 teaspoons of vanilla extract stir all ingredients together take each individual slice of bread and add it into the milk and cream mixture for about three seconds on each side lightly sprinkle cinnamon on top of each individual slice of bread you're going to flip the bread over and you're going to lightly sprinkle cinnamon onto the opposite side as well treat your fire to medium-high heat add 1 tablespoon of unsalted butter spread the butter along the bottom of your pan let the butter melt add your French toast let that sear for about 2 minutes after 2 minutes flip your french toast over let that fear for title: Make French Toast
content: today on Nico's kitchen I adore french toast and this recipe is a cracker we're making my french toast so first of all for our french toast we're going to be putting together the egg mixture that we're going to be soaking our bread in later on so firstly just into a bowl going to be cracking in some eggs next I'm going to be adding in some milk also going to be adding in some cream as well of course it wouldn't be some french toast without some cinnamon as well as love the flavor of this of course we want some nice sweetness as well so just a little bit of castor sugar and for me just something that just brings french toast alive I've got some lemon rind that I'm just going to be zesting over the top so just using a fork just give this a quick whisk around and for me that's just a very simple gorgeous way to do french toast I love the flavors in there that zest of the lemon will just bring everything alive the sweetness of the sugar and the spice from the cinnamon for the bread I'm using a French baguette cut into slices but sourdough or brioche work well two into a pan over a medium heat placing some butter dip the bread into the egg mixture for about five to ten seconds and place into the pan and cook for three to four minutes each side or until golden brown top with optional pure maple syrup and then we can get stuck into this bad boy Oh so I just love this french toast it is just amazing I love the flavors through there the cinnamon of course the cream in the milk just give it a really nice texture too and of course that lemon zest is so yummy in this and I love the bread with it it's not too big and you know you can make this in the morning if you got that sweet tooth when you get out of bed every now and again but really cool in the afternoon too with some coffee and really easy to whip up in under 10 minutes if you've got people coming around so please give this one a try you can leave off the maple syrup if you wanted to but I reckon it's a nice addition so please give this one a try you're going to love it you
